original: gang gi phyir mtshungs par ldan pa sdug pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i chos rnams kyang mi mthong la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mtshungs par ldan pa sdug pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i chos rnams kyang mi mthong la /
translated: Or, those that are not seen to be different due to the distinctions of being associated with the pleasant and so on are said to be associated.🔽Those that are not seen to be non-associated are said to be non-associated.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyang mi mthong ba de'i phyir mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa rnams kyang mi mthong ba de'i phyir mi dmigs so //
translated: For that reason, they are not apprehended.

original: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa de'i phyir rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa de'i phyir rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: Because of non-apprehension, one does not falsely project.

original: de ci'i phyir mi mthong zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir mi mthong zhe na smras pa /
translated: Why is it not seen?

original: rnam pa med pa'i shes pa yis //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i shes pa yis //
translated: It is not proper for a cognition without an aspect

original: yul la 'dzin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yul la 'dzin par mi rung ngo //
translated: to apprehend an object.

original: rnam pa tshad ma min phyir dang // mi rung phyir na cig shos min //
analyzed: rnam pa tshad ma min phyir dang // mi rung phyir na cig shos min //
translated: Because the aspect is not a valid cognition, and because it is not proper, the other is not.

original: re zhig don bye brag tu yongs su gcod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig don bye brag tu yongs su gcod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: First, it is not proper for a cognition without an aspect to apprehend a particular object.

original: rnam pa med pa'i @23b shes pas ni mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i @23b shes pas ni mi mthong ste /
translated: A cognition without an aspect does not see,

original: 'brel ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro // rnam pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no causal relation.

original: rnam pa dang bcas kyang yul 'dzin par mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas kyang yul 'dzin par mi rung ste /
translated: Even if it has an aspect, it is not proper for it to apprehend an object,

original: gang gi phyir myong ba'i tshe dngos po rig par 'gyur bas dngos pos rnam pa la ma khyab ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir myong ba'i tshe dngos po rig par 'gyur bas dngos pos rnam pa la ma khyab ste /
translated: because when one experiences it, the thing is already known, so the thing does not pervade the aspect.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa na dngos po med bzhin du yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa na dngos po med bzhin du yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists even when the thing does not exist, as in dreams and so on.

original: rnam pa yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa yang mi rung ste /
translated: The aspect is also not proper.

original: gzhan du na ni dngos po gcig / sna tshogs tshul du snang ba dag / de yi gcig pu nyams 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni dngos po gcig / sna tshogs tshul du snang ba dag / de yi gcig pu nyams 'gyur phyir //
translated: and its oneness would be lost.

original: rnam pa ji ltar bden par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa ji ltar bden par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How could it be real in any way?

original: rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other way.

original: de lta bas na mngon sum gyis mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na mngon sum gyis mi mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not seen by direct perception.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtags la sogs pas yongs su ma bcad pas na rjes su dpag pas kyang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtags la sogs pas yongs su ma bcad pas na rjes su dpag pas kyang mi mthong ngo //
translated: For the same reason, it is not discerned by inference, because it is not ascertained by a logical reason.

original: gang gi phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams dang / ldan pa ma yin pa rnams de ltar mi mthong ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams dang / ldan pa ma yin pa rnams de ltar mi mthong ba de'i phyir /
translated: Since the associated dharmas and the nonassociated dharmas are not seen in this way,

original: thob par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi skye ba yang mi mthong la spong bar bya ba rnams kyi 'gog pa yang mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi skye ba yang mi mthong la spong bar bya ba rnams kyi 'gog pa yang mi mthong ngo //
translated: the arising of the dharmas to be obtained is not seen, and the cessation of the dharmas to be abandoned is not seen.

original: bsgom par bya ba'i dbang du mdzad de /🔽'das pa'i chos rnams kyang mi mthong //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba'i dbang du mdzad de / 'das pa'i chos rnams kyang mi mthong //
translated: With regard to cultivation,🔽the sūtra says, “The past dharmas are not seen.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: lus dang lus med 'phel ba de //
analyzed: lus dang lus med 'phel ba de //
translated: The increase of the embodied and the disembodied

original: rdzas dang rdzas med rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: rdzas dang rdzas med rnam pa gnyis //
translated: Are the two kinds of increase, substantial and insubstantial.

original: ltos par gnas pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: ltos par gnas pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Because they are the nature of dependence,

original: mi mthun pa dang lhan cig bshad //
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang lhan cig bshad //
translated: They are explained together, though they are not the same.

original: lus med pa'i dngos po 'phel ba de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: lus med pa'i dngos po 'phel ba de'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the increase of the disembodied, it is said,

original: lus med pa'i chos rnams kyi 'phel ba mi mthong zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lus med pa'i chos rnams kyi 'phel ba mi mthong zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The increase of disembodied things is not seen.”

original: lus yod pa'i dngos po'i 'phel ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: lus yod pa'i dngos po'i 'phel ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With reference to the increase of the embodied, it is said,

original: lus yod pa'i chos gang yang sogs par mi byed ces gsungs so //
analyzed: lus yod pa'i chos gang yang sogs par mi byed ces gsungs so //
translated: “No embodied thing is accumulated.”🔽Just as increase is explained in two ways,

original: 'phel ba de rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'phel ba de rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa de bzhin du /
translated: so also decrease is explained in two ways.

original: rdzas su yod pa'i 'phel ba de'i dbang du mdzad pa ni snga ma yin la /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa'i 'phel ba de'i dbang du mdzad pa ni snga ma yin la /
translated: With reference to the decrease of substantial things, it is said,🔽“No substantial thing is annihilated.”🔽With reference to the decrease of imputed things, it is said,

original: btags par yod pa'i 'phel ba de'i dbang du mdzad pa ni phyi ma yin pas /
analyzed: btags par yod pa'i 'phel ba de'i dbang du mdzad pa ni phyi ma yin pas /
translated: “No imputed thing is annihilated.”

original: 'phel ba 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
analyzed: 'phel ba 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su bshad de /
translated: Thus decrease is explained in two ways.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir bshad do //
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir bshad do //
translated: In brief, it is explained in four ways.🔽Decrease is also explained in two ways,

original: 'phel ba de yang nyung du las ltos nas /
analyzed: 'phel ba de yang nyung du las ltos nas /
translated: with reference to decrease from a small amount and with reference to decrease from a large amount.

original: pha rol dang tshur rol bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol dang tshur rol bzhin du btags pa'i yod pa yin te /
translated: It exists as a designation, like the near shore and the far shore.

original: de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'bri ba dang 'grib pa lhan cig tu bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'bri ba dang 'grib pa lhan cig tu bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the decrease and diminution of the adverse side are explained together.

original: yang dag @24a * //🔽tu na sku gnyis kyi //
analyzed: yang dag @24a * // tu na sku gnyis kyi //
translated: In reality, the recollection of the Buddha

original: rang bzhin ma mthong gang yin pa //🔽de nyid sangs rgyas rjes dran te //
analyzed: rang bzhin ma mthong gang yin pa // de nyid sangs rgyas rjes dran te //
translated: is the nonseeing of the nature of the two bodies.

original: rtog pa thams cad sel ba yin //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad sel ba yin //
translated: It is the removal of all conceptual thoughts.

original: rkyen la rag las 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rkyen la rag las 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Since it arises in dependence on conditions,

original: sgyu ma bzhin du gang ma skyes //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du gang ma skyes //
translated: it is like an illusion, and is not really produced.

original: bden par bsams na gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: bden par bsams na gzugs la sogs //
translated: If one thinks of it as real, form, etc.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs ma yin //🔽dgag par bya ba med pas na //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs ma yin // dgag par bya ba med pas na //
translated: is not the Tathagata.🔽Since there is nothing to be refuted,

original: yang dag tu na dgag med mngon //
analyzed: yang dag tu na dgag med mngon //
translated: in reality there is no refutation.

original: de phyir brtags na gzugs med sogs //
analyzed: de phyir brtags na gzugs med sogs //
translated: Therefore, when one examines, form, etc.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs ma yin //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs ma yin //
translated: is not the Tathagata.

original: sku gnyis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'o //
analyzed: sku gnyis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'o //
translated: The two bodies are the body of perfect enjoyment and the transformation body.

original: rtogs pa thams cad sel ba ni rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa thams cad sel ba ni rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The removal of all conceptual thoughts is because it is the antidote to all conceptual thoughts.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni yang dag par na ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni yang dag par na ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Form and so on are not truly born,

original: rkyen gyi dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rkyen gyi dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: because they arise by the power of conditions,

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like illusions and so on.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni mtshan la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni mtshan la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the marks and so on.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid ma skyes pa gang yin pa de ni bden par na de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid ma skyes pa gang yin pa de ni bden par na de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin te /
translated: The non-arising of the marks of the enjoyment body and the emanation body is not truly the Tathāgata,

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are like illusions and so on.

original: gzugs med pa la sogs pa yang dgag par bya ba med pa'i phyir bden par med de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la sogs pa yang dgag par bya ba med pa'i phyir bden par med de /
translated: The formless and so on are not truly existent because they are not objects of refutation.

original: dgag par bya ba med na dgag pa yod par mi rung ste /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba med na dgag pa yod par mi rung ste /
translated: If there is no object of refutation, a refutation is not tenable.

original: mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs la sogs pa dgag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs la sogs pa dgag pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the refutation of the blueness and so on of the son of a barren woman.

original: de bas na gzugs med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang bden par na longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang bden par na longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the formless and so on is not truly the Tathāgata, who is characterized by the enjoyment body and the emanation body.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the absence of characteristics and so on.🔽Therefore, the negation of both

original: des na gnyi ga ma yin dang // cig shos de dag bkag shes bya //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga ma yin dang // cig shos de dag bkag shes bya //
translated: and the negation of the other should be understood.

original: de yi phyir na de gnyis ni //
analyzed: de yi phyir na de gnyis ni //
translated: Therefore, the negation of both

original: so sor dgag pa ma mdzad do //
analyzed: so sor dgag pa ma mdzad do //
translated: is not made separately.

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: If the Tathāgata is not existent as form,

original: gzugs med pa la sogs pa yang ma yin na /🔽'o na gnyi ga'i ngo bo'am /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la sogs pa yang ma yin na / 'o na gnyi ga'i ngo bo'am /
translated: and is not nonexistent as form, and so on,🔽then he would be the essence of both,

original: gnyi ga'i yin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i yin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: or the essence of neither.

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: But that is not so.

original: gnyi ga'i phyogs dgag pas ni /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i phyogs dgag pas ni /
translated: The negation of both alternatives

original: gnyi ga'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa yin pa yang bkag pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa yin pa yang bkag pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: is just the negation of the Tathāgata as the essence of both.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni med pa nyid de /
translated: The essence of neither is just nonexistence,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa gnyis ni phan tshun rnam par gcod par gnas pa'i ngo bo can yin pas gzugs dang gzugs @24b med pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa gnyis ni phan tshun rnam par gcod par gnas pa'i ngo bo can yin pas gzugs dang gzugs @24b med pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence as form and existence as formless are mutually exclusive.

original: de ltar rnam rtog med gyur na //
analyzed: de ltar rnam rtog med gyur na //
translated: When there is no such conceptualization,

original: chos kyi sku ni mthong ba ste //🔽sangs rgyas rjes dran kun mkhyen gyi //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni mthong ba ste // sangs rgyas rjes dran kun mkhyen gyi //
translated: The Dharma Body is the vision.🔽The recollection of the Buddha is the basis

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhi //
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i gzhi //
translated: of the perfection of the qualities of omniscience.

original: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pas rnam par rtog pa med par gyur na chos kyi sku mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pas rnam par rtog pa med par gyur na chos kyi sku mthong ba yin te /
translated: Thus, when one becomes free from conceptualization by the above mentioned process, one sees the Dharma Body.

original: de ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of being free from all conceptualization.

original: mthong ba de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yin te /
translated: That vision is the recollection of the Buddha,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyi gzhi yin na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyi gzhi yin na /
translated: because it is the basis of the qualities of the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and so forth of omniscience.

original: gzhan dag gi lta ci smos //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi lta ci smos //
translated: What need is there to mention the other qualities?

original: da ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i lus rnam par dbye ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i lus rnam par dbye ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the analysis of the body of the recollection of the Buddha will be explained.

original: long spyod rdzogs par mdzad pa'i sku //
analyzed: long spyod rdzogs par mdzad pa'i sku //
translated: The body that performs the enjoyment

original: rnam pa nyi shu bshad pa yin //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu bshad pa yin //
translated: is explained as having twenty aspects.

original: cig shos bco brgyad shes par bya //
analyzed: cig shos bco brgyad shes par bya //
translated: The other is to be understood as having eighteen.

original: 'dir ni de gnyis phrin las bzhi //
analyzed: 'dir ni de gnyis phrin las bzhi //
translated: Here, these two are the four activities.

original: de yi mdzad pa'i 'bras bu drug / de dngos rnam gnyis rgyu rnam bdun //
analyzed: de yi mdzad pa'i 'bras bu drug / de dngos rnam gnyis rgyu rnam bdun //
translated: both real and nominal, with seven causes.

original: mnyam pa nyid la gnas bzhin du //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la gnas bzhin du //
translated: While abiding in equality,

original: de dag la ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de dag la ni bsgom par bya //
translated: one should cultivate them.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rnam pa nyi shus bshad de /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni rnam pa nyi shus bshad de /
translated: The Enjoyment Body is explained by twenty aspects.

original: gzugs su ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gzugs su ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Beginning with “not as form,”

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba med pa ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba med pa ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
translated: up to “not without the vision of liberated wisdom.”

original: gzugs ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: gzugs ni spyi yin la /
translated: Form is general,

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po gnyis ni bye brag yin pa'i phyir bye brag tu phye ste bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po gnyis ni bye brag yin pa'i phyir bye brag tu phye ste bstan to //
translated: but the major and minor marks are specific, so they are distinguished and taught.

original: rnam par shes pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smos pas ni /
translated: By mentioning consciousness,

original: lhan cig spyod pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa yang bsdu ste /
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa yang bsdu ste /
translated: the co-occurring feelings and so forth are also included.

original: des ni rnam par smin pa'i phung po lnga po 'di bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rnam par smin pa'i phung po lnga po 'di bstan to //
translated: That explains these five resultant aggregates.

original: de'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Their cause is affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa yang dka' ba spyod pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yang dka' ba spyod pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Affliction is characterized by difficult conduct and generosity and so forth.

original: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga'i rgyu yang de nyid de /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga'i rgyu yang de nyid de /
translated: That is also the cause of the five aggregates which are without impurity.

original: des na bar du bstan no //
analyzed: des na bar du bstan no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught in the middle.

original: tshul khrims ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Morality is threefold:

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of restraint, the morality of undertaking what is beneficial for sentient beings, and the morality of gathering virtuous natures.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni zag pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / ro myang bar byed pa dang ldan pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum yod mod kyi /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni zag pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / ro myang bar byed pa dang ldan pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum yod mod kyi /
translated: Although concentration is threefold by way of the distinction of being with or without impurity and with or without relish,

original: 'dir ni zag pa med pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni zag pa med pa gzung ngo //
translated: here it is taken as being without impurity.

original: shes rab ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sas bsdus pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is included in the stages of the Joyous and so forth.

original: rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Liberation is the abandonment of the obscurations of affliction and of the knowable.

original: @25a * // rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ni sgrib pa gnyis las nges par grol ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: @25a * // rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba ni sgrib pa gnyis las nges par grol ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
translated: The vision of the pristine wisdom of liberation is the pristine wisdom of omniscience which is definitely liberated from the two obscurations.

original: yang na ye shes ni ye shes nyid do //
analyzed: yang na ye shes ni ye shes nyid do //
translated: Alternatively, wisdom is just pristine wisdom.

original: mthong ba ni mngon par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: mthong ba ni mngon par shes pa rnams so //
translated: Seeing is the superknowledges.

original: skye bar ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: skye bar ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Not born, up to

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched med par ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar rnams ni /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched med par ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar rnams ni /
translated: not without aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: rnam pa bco brgyad kyis sprul ba'i sku bstan par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bco brgyad kyis sprul ba'i sku bstan par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that the emanation body is taught by these eighteen aspects.

original: skye ba ni mngal na gnas pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba ni mngal na gnas pa bzung ngo //
translated: Birth is the taking of a womb.

original: rigs ni sh'akya'i rigs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs ni sh'akya'i rigs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Family is the Shakya family, and so on.

original: rus ni goo ta ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rus ni goo ta ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: Lineage is Gautama, and so on.

original: 'khor ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rgyal po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' dang / rgyal po la sogs pa'o //
translated: retinue is shravakas, bodhisattvas, kings, and so on.

original: gnas pa ni byams pa la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa la sogs pa'o //🔽thob pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i lam thob pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni byams pa la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gnas pa la sogs pa'o // thob pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i lam thob pa'o //
translated: Abiding is love, and so on, and the buddha abodes, and so on.🔽Attainment is the attainment of the path for attaining omniscient wisdom.

original: mngon par rtogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Realization is omniscient wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir gtso bor kun nas khong du chud pa mngon par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir gtso bor kun nas khong du chud pa mngon par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because here, primarily, it is the clear comprehension of the realization that is being discussed.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The defilements are passion, etc.

original: phung po la sogs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The aggregates, etc. are twofold: with-outflows and without-outflows.

original: mthun mthun du gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: mthun mthun du gzung bar bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as corresponding to the above.

original: de dag thams cad kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba'i bsam pa'i bye brag gis bstan to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gdul ba'i bsam pa'i bye brag gis bstan to //
translated: All of these were taught by the Lord in accordance with the various inclinations of those to be taught.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul ba'i sku de gnyis kyi phrin las ni rnam pa bzhir gsungs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul ba'i sku de gnyis kyi phrin las ni rnam pa bzhir gsungs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The activity of the Enjoyment body and the Transformation body is said to be fourfold.

original: shes par ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: shes par ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: It should be understood that it is not that they do not know,

original: chos mi ston par ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
analyzed: chos mi ston par ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
translated: up to it is not that they do not teach the Dharma.

original: de la gdul ba rnams kyi khams dang / bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / spyod pa la sogs pa la lta ba ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la gdul ba rnams kyi khams dang / bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / spyod pa la sogs pa la lta ba ni shes pa'o //
translated: Among them, knowledge is the observation of the various elements, inclinations, faculties, conduct, etc. of those to be taught.

original: khams la sogs pa la gzigs nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i thabs ston pa ni chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: khams la sogs pa la gzigs nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i thabs ston pa ni chos ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is the teaching of the means of eliminating the afflictions, after having seen the elements, etc.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul ba'i sku de gnyis kyis mdzad pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa drug tu gsungs par shes par bya ste /🔽bdag rnam par dag par ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul ba'i sku de gnyis kyis mdzad pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa drug tu gsungs par shes par bya ste / bdag rnam par dag par ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The result of the activity of those two, the beatific and the emanation bodies, should be understood as being described in six ways.

original: gzhan gyi don du ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
translated: The purification of the self, up to the purification of the other.

original: bdag rnam par dag par bya ba ni nyan thos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bdag rnam par dag par bya ba ni nyan thos rnams kyi'o //
translated: The purification of the self is for the disciples.

original: gzhan rnam par dag par bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' @25b rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnam par dag par bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' @25b rnams kyi'o //
translated: The purification of the other is for the bodhisattvas.

original: sems can rnam par dag par bya ba ni gang zag la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sems can rnam par dag par bya ba ni gang zag la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The purification of sentient beings is for those who are attached to the individual.

original: sems can med pa rnam par dag par bya ba ni bdag med pa mthong ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sems can med pa rnam par dag par bya ba ni bdag med pa mthong ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The purification of the nonexistence of sentient beings is for those who see selflessness.

original: bdag gi don ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The benefit for oneself is for the disciples, etc.

original: gzhan gyi don ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: The benefit of others is for the bodhisattvas.

original: de'i dngos po rnam pa gnyis ni phrin las tha ma'i ngo bo rnam pa gnyis su gsungs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po rnam pa gnyis ni phrin las tha ma'i ngo bo rnam pa gnyis su gsungs par shes par bya ste /
translated: The two kinds of things for that should be understood as the two kinds of natures of the final action.

original: chos su ma yin /
analyzed: chos su ma yin /
translated: Not in the Dharma,

original: 'dul ba ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dul ba ma yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: not in the Vinaya.

original: chos ni mdo sde la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni mdo sde la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Dharma is the Sutra Collection, etc.

original: 'dul ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul ba'i sde snod dang / nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'i sde snod do//
analyzed: 'dul ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i 'dul ba'i sde snod dang / nyan thos kyi 'dul ba'i sde snod do//
translated: The Vinaya is the Bodhisattva Vinaya Pitaka and the Sravaka Vinaya Pitaka.

original: mdzad pa'i 'bras bu rgyu gang gis 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de ni rnam pa bdun du gsungs te /
analyzed: mdzad pa'i 'bras bu rgyu gang gis 'grub par 'gyur ba'i rgyu de ni rnam pa bdun du gsungs te /
translated: The cause of the effect of action is the cause by which one accomplishes. That cause is said to be sevenfold.

original: lus rnam par dag par ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: lus rnam par dag par ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Not pure in body,

original: da ltar byung ba'i spyod pa rnam par dag par ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i spyod pa rnam par dag par ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
translated: up to not pure in present conduct.

original: lus rnam par dag pa ni lus kyi las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: lus rnam par dag pa ni lus kyi las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Purity of body is the complete purity of the three kinds of bodily actions.

original: ngag rnam par dag pa ni ngag gi las rnam pa bzhi yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: ngag rnam par dag pa ni ngag gi las rnam pa bzhi yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Purity of speech is the complete purity of the four kinds of verbal actions.

original: yid rnam par dag pa ni yid kyi las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: yid rnam par dag pa ni yid kyi las rnam pa gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The purification of mind is the complete purification of the three types of mental action.

original: thabs 'dis ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i bya ba'i 'bras bu 'grub bo //
analyzed: thabs 'dis ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i bya ba'i 'bras bu 'grub bo //
translated: By this method, the result of the activity of the Sravakas, etc. is accomplished.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'bras bu ni spyod pa rnam par dag pas 'grub ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'bras bu ni spyod pa rnam par dag pas 'grub ste /
translated: The result of the Bodhisattvas is accomplished by the purification of their activity.

original: spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'o //
translated: Their activity is the ten perfections.

original: shin tu myur na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: shin tu myur na bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
translated: By this activity, they become Buddhas in three periods of countless aeons, if they are very quick.

original: de'i phyir spyod pa 'di ni yun ring mo zhig gis rnam par dag par 'gyur bas sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyod pa 'di ni yun ring mo zhig gis rnam par dag par 'gyur bas sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, since this activity is purified after a long time, the beginning, etc. is mentioned.

original: bdag gi rnam par ma yin /
analyzed: bdag gi rnam par ma yin /
translated: Not in the aspect of self,🔽not in the aspect of other.

original: gzhan gyi rnam par ma yin zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de rnal 'byor can gyis mnyam pa nyid la gnas nas bsgom par bya'i //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam par ma yin zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de rnal 'byor can gyis mnyam pa nyid la gnas nas bsgom par bya'i //
translated: This recollection of the Buddha should be cultivated by the yogi, abiding in equality.

original: de ma yin par mi bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ma yin par mi bya bar bstan to //
translated: It is taught that it should not be done otherwise.

original: bdag ces smos pa ni sgom pa po bstan to //
analyzed: bdag ces smos pa ni sgom pa po bstan to //
translated: The word self indicates the meditator.

original: gzhan zhes smos pa ni bsgom par bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i rnam pa bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan zhes smos pa ni bsgom par bya ba dang / bsgom pa'i rnam pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “and so on” indicates the object of meditation and the aspects of meditation.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni bsgom par bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sgom pa po rnal 'byor can dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa gang gis bsgom par bya ba ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni bsgom par bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dang / sgom pa po rnal 'byor can dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa gang gis bsgom par bya ba ste /
translated: The equality of the object of meditation, the Tathāgata, the meditator, the practitioner, and the aspects of meditation, such as form, is

original: de yang de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir te /🔽de ltar na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'khor gsum yongs su dag par @26a * //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir te / de ltar na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'khor gsum yongs su dag par @26a * //
translated: because they are of one taste in suchness.

original: bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the recollection of the Buddha is cultivated as being completely pure with regard to the three sectors.

original: de ltar ma byas na ni dmigs pa kho nar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na ni dmigs pa kho nar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not cultivated in this way, it will fall into the error of having an objective support.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang /🔽yang na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang / yang na longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
translated: Moreover,

original: rgyu dang bcas dang 'bras bur bcas //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas dang 'bras bur bcas //
translated: The enjoyment body is the cause and the result.

original: yang dag tu na gang ma mthong //
analyzed: yang dag tu na gang ma mthong //
translated: It is not really seen.

original: de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran //
translated: This is the recollection of the Buddha.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa nyi shu ste //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa nyi shu ste //
translated: The enjoyment body is twentyfold,

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: as before.

original: nyon mongs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs zhes pa ni /
translated: The afflictions are

original: bshad pa 'di'i skabs su nyon mongs ba rnam pa gnyis la bya'o //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di'i skabs su nyon mongs ba rnam pa gnyis la bya'o //
translated: In this explanation, the afflictions are of two kinds.

original: 'bras bu nyi shu gnyis su bzhed //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyi shu gnyis su bzhed //
translated: The result is accepted as twenty-two.

original: skye bar ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: skye bar ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: From “not for birth” up to

original: chos mi ston bar ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
analyzed: chos mi ston bar ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
translated: “not for not teaching the Dharma.”

original: sprul pa'i sku de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: This is the result of the emanation body.

original: de'i rgyu ni bco lnga ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni bco lnga ste /
translated: Its cause is fifteen.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de'i rgyu'i grangs ni bco lnga'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de'i rgyu'i grangs ni bco lnga'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The number of causes of that enjoyment body is fifteen.

original: bdag rnam par dag par bya bar ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bdag rnam par dag par bya bar ma yin zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: From “not for purifying the self” up to

original: da ltar byung ba'i spyod pa rnam par dag par ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i spyod pa rnam par dag par ma yin zhes bya ba yan chad do //
translated: “not for purifying present conduct.”🔽Why fifteen?

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa bco lnga zhe na /🔽smras pa / gang gi phyir ni nan tan byed //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa bco lnga zhe na / smras pa / gang gi phyir ni nan tan byed //
translated: It is said:

original: ji ltar gang la bye brag gis //
analyzed: ji ltar gang la bye brag gis //
translated: Because of what, how, and by what means,🔽and for what purpose is there practice?

original: ci'i phyir nan tan byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nan tan byed ce na /
translated: Why is there practice?

original: bdag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / sems can rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / sems can rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir ro //
translated: For the purification of self, for the purification of others, for the purification of beings, and for the sake of one's own goal and the goal of others.

original: de la bdag rnam par dag par bya ba ni gzhan rnam par dag par bya ba'i thabs su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir sngar bshad de /
analyzed: de la bdag rnam par dag par bya ba ni gzhan rnam par dag par bya ba'i thabs su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir sngar bshad de /
translated: Of these, the purification of self is explained first, because it is the means for the purification of others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni gzhan rnam par dag pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni gzhan rnam par dag pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the bodhisattvas, the purification of others is primary.

original: rnam par dag pa 'di gnyis ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa 'di gnyis ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: These two purifications are characterized by the abandonment of the obscurations of afflictions and of the knowable.

original: bdag dang gzhan dang mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dang mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: They are to be applied respectively to self and other.

original: rnam par dag pa de gnyis ka yang sems yin pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu sems can rnam par dag par bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa de gnyis ka yang sems yin pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu sems can rnam par dag par bya ba bstan te /
translated: Since both of these purifications are mental, the purification of beings is taught next.

original: sems can ni sems yin no //
analyzed: sems can ni sems yin no //
translated: Beings are mental.

original: yang na rnam par dag pa 'di gnyis la brten nas /🔽sems rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na rnam par dag pa 'di gnyis la brten nas / sems rnam par dag pa thob pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, on the basis of these two purities,

original: sems can rnam par dag par bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: sems can rnam par dag par bya bar bstan to //
translated: the purity of sentient beings is taught, because the purity of mind is attained.

original: bdag nyid stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyi snod du 'gyur bar bya ba ni bdag gi don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams kyi snod du 'gyur bar bya ba ni bdag gi don to //
translated: The benefit for oneself is the transformation of one's body into a vessel for the qualities of the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, and so forth.

original: gzhan dag theg pa gsum la gnas pa'i yon tan rnams dang / bde 'gro'i snod du @26b 'gyur bar bya ba ni gzhan gyi don te /
analyzed: gzhan dag theg pa gsum la gnas pa'i yon tan rnams dang / bde 'gro'i snod du @26b 'gyur bar bya ba ni gzhan gyi don te /
translated: The benefit for others is the transformation of others into vessels for the qualities of the three vehicles and for happy rebirth.

original: de gnyis kyi sngon du dag pa 'gro bas de'i phyir phyis bstan to //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi sngon du dag pa 'gro bas de'i phyir phyis bstan to //
translated: Since these two are preceded by purity, they are taught later.

original: ji ltar na nan tan byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nan tan byed ce na /
translated: How does one practice?

original: chos dang 'dul bas so //
analyzed: chos dang 'dul bas so //
translated: By means of the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: gang la nan tan byed ce na /🔽de ni / zag bcas cig shos bye brag gis //
analyzed: gang la nan tan byed ce na / de ni / zag bcas cig shos bye brag gis //
translated: What does one practice?

original: bya ba rnam gnyis shes par bya //
analyzed: bya ba rnam gnyis shes par bya //
translated: That is known as the twofold activity with regard to the contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: cig shos zhes bya ba zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: cig shos zhes bya ba zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The uncontaminated is the other.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i lus rnam par dag pa la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i lus rnam par dag pa la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: The contaminated and uncontaminated purities of body, etc. have been taught.

original: zag pa med pa ni spyod pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni spyod pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The uncontaminated is the purity of conduct.

original: spyod pa rnam par dag pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te //
analyzed: spyod pa rnam par dag pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te //
translated: The purity of conduct is the perfections such as generosity.

original: de yang 'dir sas bsdus ba gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dir sas bsdus ba gzung bar bya'o //
translated: And that is to be understood as included in the stages.

original: lus rnam par dag pa la sogs pa ni spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir phyis bstan to //🔽lhag ma dag ni sngar bshad bzhin //
analyzed: lus rnam par dag pa la sogs pa ni spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir phyis bstan to // lhag ma dag ni sngar bshad bzhin //
translated: The purity of body, etc. is taught later because it is a prerequisite for the purity of conduct.🔽The rest are as previously explained.

original: ma lus par bzung ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ma lus par bzung ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder are to be understood as before.

original: da ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de nyid kyi rnam grangs brjod pas bstod par mdzad de /
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa de nyid kyi rnam grangs brjod pas bstod par mdzad de /
translated: Now, in order to praise that very recollection of the Buddha, he states its synonyms:

original: sar pa 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin //
analyzed: sar pa 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid yin //
translated: It is the cause for entering the new stage,

original: gang tshe de las ma 'thob pa //
analyzed: gang tshe de las ma 'thob pa //
translated: When one does not attain from that,

original: sangs rgyas nyid du gcig tu ngos //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du gcig tu ngos //
translated: It is the single destination for buddhahood.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi sa 'thob la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi sa 'thob la //
translated: Attaining the stage of buddhahood,

original: gnas skabs dag ni thams cad du //
analyzed: gnas skabs dag ni thams cad du //
translated: In all circumstances,

original: bdud kyi las ni rnam spong na //
analyzed: bdud kyi las ni rnam spong na //
translated: Abandoning the works of Mara,

original: gzungs kyis 'thob par mi 'gyur gang //
analyzed: gzungs kyis 'thob par mi 'gyur gang //
translated: What is not attained by the dhāraṇīs?

original: thob bya gzhan ni ci zhig yod //
analyzed: thob bya gzhan ni ci zhig yod //
translated: What else is there to attain?

original: shes pa gang gis chos thams cad kyi dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor mi 'dzin pa de ni /
analyzed: shes pa gang gis chos thams cad kyi dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor mi 'dzin pa de ni /
translated: The cognition by which one does not apprehend any entity of all dharmas as existent or nonexistent, etc.

original: chos thams cad mi 'dzin par mos pas spyod pa'i sa chen po'i chen pos bsdus pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi 'dzin par mos pas spyod pa'i sa chen po'i chen pos bsdus pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: is the cognition included in the great of the great stage of practice through devoted interest, since it is the devoted interest in not apprehending all dharmas.

original: de 'dis 'jug par byed pas na /
analyzed: de 'dis 'jug par byed pas na /
translated: Since this is entered by means of this,

original: chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: it is the recollection of the Buddha called “entry into the nonapprehension of all dharmas”.

original: 'dis ni gzungs mos pas spyod pa'i sa chen po'i chen po la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzungs mos pas spyod pa'i sa chen po'i chen po la 'jug pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is the cause for entering the great of the great stage of practice through devoted interest.

original: chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba ni stong pa nyid de //
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba ni stong pa nyid de //
translated: The emptiness of all dharmas is their true nature.

original: der chos thams cad de'i bdag nyid du 'du ba'o //
analyzed: der chos thams cad de'i bdag nyid du 'du ba'o //
translated: All dharmas are included in that as their essence.

original: de la mi 'jigs pa ni mi skrag pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi 'jigs pa ni mi skrag pa'o //
translated: Fearlessness in that is non-terror.

original: mi skrag pa ni sa dang po ste /
analyzed: mi skrag pa ni sa dang po ste /
translated: Non-terror is the first stage.

original: de rtogs pas de la mi 'jigs so //
analyzed: de rtogs pas de la mi 'jigs so //
translated: By realizing that, one is fearless in that.

original: de gzungs 'dis 'thob par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de gzungs 'dis 'thob par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since one attains that by means of this dhāraṇī,

original: chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba la mi 'jigs pa 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba la mi 'jigs pa 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs so //
translated: The Dhāraṇī called “Attaining Fearlessness in the Correct Assembly of All Dharmas”.

original: de'i ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir don dam pa sgrub pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam pa sgrub pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “By accomplishing the ultimate”.

original: don dam pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: don dam pa ni chos kyi sku ste /
translated: The ultimate is the Dharma Body.

original: @27a * // don dam pa sgrub pa des ni gzungs 'di sa dang po la sogs pa'i rgyur bstan to //
analyzed: @27a * // don dam pa sgrub pa des ni gzungs 'di sa dang po la sogs pa'i rgyur bstan to //
translated: By accomplishing the ultimate, this Dhāraṇī is shown as the cause of the first ground and so forth.

original: gzungs 'dis gcig tu nges par sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzungs 'dis gcig tu nges par sangs rgyas su 'gyur te /
translated: By this Dhāraṇī, one definitely becomes a Buddha.

original: 'di ltar gcig tu nges pa ni sangs rgyas nyid gdon mi za ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig tu nges pa ni sangs rgyas nyid gdon mi za ba ste /
translated: Thus, the definite one is undoubtedly Buddhahood itself.

original: de 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: de 'thob pa'o //
translated: That is attained.

original: de bas na gcig tu nges pa 'thob pa'i phyir bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de bas na gcig tu nges pa 'thob pa'i phyir bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, in order to attain the definite one, there is the Samādhi called “Fulfilling All Aspirations”.

original: 'dis ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa 'thob par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni sa brgyad pa la sogs pa 'thob par bstan te /
translated: By this, the attainment of the eighth ground and so forth is shown.

original: sa brgyad pa la ni gcig tu nges pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la ni gcig tu nges pa 'thob bo //
translated: On the eighth ground, the definite one is attained.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa yang gzungs 'di nyid kyis 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa yang gzungs 'di nyid kyis 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: And the ground of Buddhahood is also attained by this very Dhāraṇī.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba thams cad gang gi rtsa ba rgyu yin pa de ni dge ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba can no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba thams cad gang gi rtsa ba rgyu yin pa de ni dge ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba can no //
translated: Thus, it is the root of all mundane and supramundane virtues.

original: de ni dge ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba can yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni dge ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba can yang yin la /
translated: It is the root of all virtues,

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ye shes kyang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ye shes kyang yin te /
translated: and it is also the knowledge that does not depend on others.

original: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ye shes ni rang byung gi yin no//
analyzed: gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ye shes ni rang byung gi yin no//
translated: The knowledge that does not depend on others is self-arisen.

original: yang na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la gzhan la rag ma las ba'i ye shes zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la gzhan la rag ma las ba'i ye shes zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Or else, the knowledge that does not depend on others should be understood as referring to all the roots of virtue.

original: de rtogs pa ni 'dis rtogs par byed pas na gzungs 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni 'dis rtogs par byed pas na gzungs 'di nyid yin no //
translated: Since it is this that causes one to realize that, it is the dhāraṇī.

original: de lta bas na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la gzhan la rag ma las pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it causes one to realize the knowledge that does not depend on others with regard to all the roots of virtue,

original: chos kyi gter gyi rigs las byung ba'i mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang pos gnas pa zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi gter gyi rigs las byung ba'i mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang pos gnas pa zil gyis mi non pa zhes bya ba'i gzungs te /
translated: it is the dhāraṇī called “The Unconquerable State Endowed with the Major and Minor Marks That Arose from the Family of the Dharma Treasure.”

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi gter ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi gter ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The treasure of mundane and supramundane dharmas is the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: de nyid rigs yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rigs yin te /
translated: He is the family,

original: mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po de dag gi skye ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po de dag gi skye ba'i gnas so //
translated: because he is the source of the major and minor characteristics.

original: chos kyi gter gyi rigs las byung ba'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po byed par gyur pa de dag gis na //
analyzed: chos kyi gter gyi rigs las byung ba'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po byed par gyur pa de dag gis na //
translated: The major and minor characteristics, which are the products of the family of the treasure of the Dharma,

original: gzhan su dag gis kyang gzungs 'di'i gnas pa zil gyis mi non zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan su dag gis kyang gzungs 'di'i gnas pa zil gyis mi non zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: are not surpassed by anyone else.

original: 'di las mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor can gyis bdud kyi las rnam par spong ba yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di las mos pas spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs thams cad la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor can gyis bdud kyi las rnam par spong ba yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogin who is established in all the stages, such as the stage of action in faith, attains the abandonment of the works of Mara through this.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: de phyir dam pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de phyir dam pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the highest.

original: sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: Buddhahood.

original: 'dis kun nas sngon du tshol bas na /
analyzed: 'dis kun nas sngon du tshol bas na /
translated: Because it is sought after by all,

original: dam pa yongs su tshol ba ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: dam pa yongs su tshol ba ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: the search for the highest is emptiness.

original: de la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in that.

original: de lta @27b bas na dam pa yongs su tshol ba la mkhas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta @27b bas na dam pa yongs su tshol ba la mkhas pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of being skilled in seeking the ultimate,

original: bdud kyi las thams cad yang dag par 'da' ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs te /
analyzed: bdud kyi las thams cad yang dag par 'da' ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs te /
translated: the dhāraṇī is called “transcending all the works of Māra.”

original: rnam grangs de dag gis gzungs ni don thams cad 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir don che ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs de dag gis gzungs ni don thams cad 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir don che ba nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: By these synonyms, the dhāraṇī is shown to be of great import because it is the cause for obtaining all goals.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: yang na dad pas mos la sogs //
analyzed: yang na dad pas mos la sogs //
translated: For those with faith and interest, etc.,

original: dbang du mdzad de go rims bzhin //
analyzed: dbang du mdzad de go rims bzhin //
translated: it is taught in order,

original: ming rnam lnga po 'di dag ni //
analyzed: ming rnam lnga po 'di dag ni //
translated: and these five names

original: don dang mthun par gsungs pa yin //🔽'di ltar dad pas mos pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ming dang po gsungs te /
analyzed: don dang mthun par gsungs pa yin // 'di ltar dad pas mos pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ming dang po gsungs te /
translated: are said to accord with the meaning.

original: de dag chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de dag chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Thus, for those with faith and interest, the first name is taught because they engage in not grasping any phenomena.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ming gnyis pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ming gnyis pa gsungs te /
translated: For those who have attained patient forbearance with respect to the teaching of non-production, the second name is taught.

original: de dag gis chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba la mi 'jigs pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis chos thams cad yang dag par 'du ba la mi 'jigs pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they attain fearlessness in the correct comprehension of all dharmas.

original: phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ming gsum pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ming gsum pa gsungs te /
translated: The third name is for the irreversible.

original: de dag gis gcig tu nges pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis gcig tu nges pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they attain certainty.

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ming bzhi pa gsungs te /
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas ming bzhi pa gsungs te /
translated: The fourth name is for those obstructed by one birth.

original: de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la gzhan la rag ma lus pa'i ye shes rtogs pas /
analyzed: de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la gzhan la rag ma lus pa'i ye shes rtogs pas /
translated: Because they have the realization of the knowledge that is not dependent on another for all the roots of virtue.

original: ji skad gsungs pa thams cad 'grub bo //🔽yang na dngos po thams cad rtogs pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid de dag thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa thams cad 'grub bo // yang na dngos po thams cad rtogs pa na dge ba'i rtsa ba bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid de dag thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: They accomplish all that is taught.

original: gzhan la rag las pa med pa'i ye shes sgrub bo //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa med pa'i ye shes sgrub bo //
translated: Or else, when they realize all things, they accomplish the knowledge that is not dependent on another, because they accomplish all those roots of virtue that are characterized by the accumulations of merit and knowledge.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni nan tan byed pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni nan tan byed pa ste /
translated: Accomplishment means practice.

original: de las ji skad gsungs pa thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ji skad gsungs pa thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, all that is taught is accomplished.

original: srid pa tham pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ming lnga pa gsungs te /
analyzed: srid pa tham pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad nas ming lnga pa gsungs te /
translated: The five names are taught for the sake of those who are in the five destinies.

original: de dag byang chub kyi shing drung kho nar byang chub 'thob pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de dag byang chub kyi shing drung kho nar byang chub 'thob pa'i tshe /
translated: They attain enlightenment only at the foot of the enlightenment tree.

original: stong pa nyid la goms pas bdud kyi las thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro //🔽da ni sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la goms pas bdud kyi las thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ro // da ni sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan te /
translated: By being accustomed to emptiness, they completely transcend all the works of Mara.🔽Now, in order to teach the benefits, it is said:

original: 'bras bu yang dag bstan pas kyang //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang dag bstan pas kyang //
translated: “Those Bodhisattvas, O Śāriputra, who have set out for the supreme, highest enlightenment, and who have been predicted by the Tathāgatas to be predicted, and who are predicted by the Tathāgatas, the Saints, the perfectly enlightened ones, to be perfectly enlightened, will be endowed with these five names.🔽They will be called Bodhisattva, and also Mahāsattva, and also Vidyācaraṇa-sampanna, and also Sa-ga-ra-ja, and also Jina-putra.🔽They will be called Bodhisattva because they are endowed with the mind of enlightenment.🔽They will be called Mahāsattva because they have the great thought of enlightenment.🔽They will be called Vidyācaraṇa-sampanna because they are endowed with knowledge and conduct.

original: gdul ba rnams ni 'jug 'gyur te //
analyzed: gdul ba rnams ni 'jug 'gyur te //
translated: They will be called Sa-ga-ra-ja because they are the sons of the Jinas.

original: de yi phyir na thub pa yis //
analyzed: de yi phyir na thub pa yis //
translated: They will be called Jina-putra because they are the sons of the Jinas.🔽The Victorious One has taught

original: thugs rjes phan yon yang dag gsungs //
analyzed: thugs rjes phan yon yang dag gsungs //
translated: the benefits of these two,

original: chos dang dad pas rjes 'brang ba'i //🔽dbang mdzad 'di yi phan yon gnyis //🔽rgyal bas @28a * //
analyzed: chos dang dad pas rjes 'brang ba'i // dbang mdzad 'di yi phan yon gnyis // rgyal bas @28a * //
translated: the one who follows the teachings and the one who follows faith.

original: gsungs te snga ma snga //
analyzed: gsungs te snga ma snga //
translated: The former is the former,

original: phyi ma po ni phyi ma yin //
analyzed: phyi ma po ni phyi ma yin //
translated: and the latter is the latter.

original: gdul ba'i rnam pa gnyis yin te //
analyzed: gdul ba'i rnam pa gnyis yin te //
translated: There are two types of disciples:

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang // dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang // dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: the one who follows the teachings and the one who follows faith.

original: de la snga ma chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas phan yon snga ma ste /
analyzed: de la snga ma chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas phan yon snga ma ste /
translated: The former benefit is for one who follows the teaching.

original: 'thad pa dang bcas pa bstan pa'o//
analyzed: 'thad pa dang bcas pa bstan pa'o//
translated: It is taught along with a rationale.

original: phyi ma dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas phan yon phyi ma ste /
analyzed: phyi ma dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang du mdzad nas phan yon phyi ma ste /
translated: The latter benefit is for one who follows faith.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis bstan to //
translated: It is taught in the verses.

original: yang na phan yon gnyis ka yang //
analyzed: yang na phan yon gnyis ka yang //
translated: Or, both benefits

original: chos dang dad pas rjes 'brang ba'i //🔽phyi ma snga ma'i btags pa yin //
analyzed: chos dang dad pas rjes 'brang ba'i // phyi ma snga ma'i btags pa yin //
translated: are for one who follows the teaching and one who follows faith.🔽The latter is the nominal former.

original: phyi ma yi ni gnyi ga dngos //🔽yang na phan yon snga ma ni 'thad pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi ma yi ni gnyi ga dngos // yang na phan yon snga ma ni 'thad pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: The latter is the actual former.

original: snga ma chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i dngos yin la /
analyzed: snga ma chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i dngos yin la /
translated: Or, the former benefit is the actual former for one who follows the teaching because it is taught along with a rationale.

original: phan yon phyi ma ni btags pa yin te /
analyzed: phan yon phyi ma ni btags pa yin te /
translated: The latter benefit is nominal because

original: de dag kyang de la shas kyis phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang de la shas kyis phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they benefit it to some extent.

original: phyi ma dad pas rjes su 'brang ba la ni phan yon gnyi gas lhur phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dngos yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma dad pas rjes su 'brang ba la ni phan yon gnyi gas lhur phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dngos yin no //
translated: The latter benefit is actual for one who follows faith because both benefits benefit it primarily.

original: stobs dang pha rol phyin sa dang // mi 'jigs yon tan la sogs pa //
analyzed: stobs dang pha rol phyin sa dang // mi 'jigs yon tan la sogs pa //
translated: fearlessnesses, qualities, and so on,🔽the doors of liberation, the superknowledges,

original: rnam thar sgo dang mngon shes dang // ting 'dzin gzungs sgo mtha' yas pa'am //
analyzed: rnam thar sgo dang mngon shes dang // ting 'dzin gzungs sgo mtha' yas pa'am //
translated: the infinite doors of meditative stabilization and retention,

analyzed: de dag mtha' yas thabs rnams kyi // sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa // de phyir mtha' yas sgos bsgrub pa'i //
translated: the means of accomplishing those infinite

original: gzungs zhes bya bar bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: gzungs zhes bya bar bsgrags pa yin //
translated: are proclaimed to be the dhāraṇī of infinite accomplishment.

original: stobs ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa bcu'o //
analyzed: stobs ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa bcu'o //
translated: The powers are the ten powers, such as the power of knowledge of what is possible and impossible.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bcu'o //🔽sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa yan chad /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa bcu'o // sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa yan chad /
translated: The perfections are the ten perfections, such as generosity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'od man chad sa bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du 'od man chad sa bcu gnyis so //
translated: The stages are the twelve stages, from the stage of engagement through firm conviction up to the stage of Universal Light.

original: mi 'jigs pa ni sa bcu'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni sa bcu'o //
translated: The fearlessnesses are the ten fearlessnesses.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni /
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the root text refers to

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The three establishments of mindfulness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha are included in the qualities of love, etc.
