analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams ni thugs rje chen po dang / bshol ba med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The doors of liberation are great compassion, non-deferment, etc.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams ni lha'i mig la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams ni lha'i mig la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The superknowledges are the five beginning with the divine eye.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams ni nam mkha'i mdzod la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams ni nam mkha'i mdzod la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meditative concentrations are the Sky Treasury, etc.

original: gzungs kyi sgo ni chos zab mo la bzod pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo ni chos zab mo la bzod pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la sogs pa ste /
translated: The dhāraṇī-doors are the dhāraṇī-doors of the patience of the profound doctrine, etc.

original: gang gi phyir mtha' yas pa 'di dag thams @28b cad sgrub cing rdzogs par byed pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mtha' yas pa 'di dag thams @28b cad sgrub cing rdzogs par byed pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because it accomplishes and perfects all these infinite qualities,

original: sgo mtha' yas pa sgrub pa'i gzungs zhes bsgrags so //
analyzed: sgo mtha' yas pa sgrub pa'i gzungs zhes bsgrags so //
translated: it is proclaimed as the dhāraṇī-door accomplishing infinite doors.

original: yang na gang gi phyir ji skad bstan pa 'di dag thams cad mtha' yas sgrub pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na gang gi phyir ji skad bstan pa 'di dag thams cad mtha' yas sgrub pa de'i phyir /
translated: Or, because it accomplishes all these infinite qualities as they have been explained,

original: sgo mtha' yas pas sgrub pa zhes bsgrags so //
analyzed: sgo mtha' yas pas sgrub pa zhes bsgrags so //
translated: It is proclaimed as the dhāraṇī of infinite doors.

original: 'dir ni don gyi gzungs yin pa'am yang na gzungs don ston pa yi //
analyzed: 'dir ni don gyi gzungs yin pa'am yang na gzungs don ston pa yi //
translated: Here, it is either the dhāraṇī of the meaning or the dhāraṇī that teaches the meaning.

original: yi ge'i tshogs ni 'di nyid la //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs ni 'di nyid la //
translated: In this very collection of letters,

original: gzungs zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin //
analyzed: gzungs zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin //
translated: it is considered to be called the dhāraṇī.

original: thos sogs las byung shes pa rnams //
analyzed: thos sogs las byung shes pa rnams //
translated: The knowledges arisen from hearing and so on

original: chung dang 'bring la sogs ldan pas //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring la sogs ldan pas //
translated: are endowed with small, medium, and so forth.

original: gzungs kyi don ni thob gyur nas //
analyzed: gzungs kyi don ni thob gyur nas //
translated: Having attained the meaning of the dhāraṇī,

original: byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba gang //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar 'gyur ba gang //
translated: one becomes a bodhisattva.

original: de dag phyir mi ldog nyid du //
analyzed: de dag phyir mi ldog nyid du //
translated: For their sake, it is said to be irreversible,

original: mtshungs te dus ni tha dad do //
analyzed: mtshungs te dus ni tha dad do //
translated: but the time is different.

original: byang chub myur ba nyid gsungs gang //
analyzed: byang chub myur ba nyid gsungs gang //
translated: What is said to be the swift enlightenment

original: de ni gzhan la ltos te dgongs //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la ltos te dgongs //
translated: is considered in relation to others.

original: gang gi tshe sgo mtha' yas pas bsgrub pa'i gzungs zhes bya ba /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgo mtha' yas pas bsgrub pa'i gzungs zhes bya ba /
translated: When the dhāraṇī called the accomplishment through infinite doors is

original: 'dir gzungs nyid sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i mtshan nyid du bzung ba de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzungs nyid sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i mtshan nyid du bzung ba de'i tshe ni /
translated: taken here as the characteristic of the recollection of the Buddha, then at that time,

original: don thob pa zhes bya ba 'di la don gyi sgra ni ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: don thob pa zhes bya ba 'di la don gyi sgra ni ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin te /
translated: the so-called attainment of the meaning is taught as the essence of the word meaning.

original: ngo bo nyid de yang 'dir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa nyid la bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe gzungs kyi don ston pa'i yi ge'i tshogs la 'dir gzungs zhes bya bar gzungs ba de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de yang 'dir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa nyid la bya'o // gang gi tshe gzungs kyi don ston pa'i yi ge'i tshogs la 'dir gzungs zhes bya bar gzungs ba de'i tshe ni /
translated: And that reality here is to be understood as the recollection of the Buddha.

original: sgo mtha' yas pas ba sgrub pa'i gzungs 'di'i don gang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa la bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgo mtha' yas pas ba sgrub pa'i gzungs 'di'i don gang rjod par byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa la bya ba ste /
translated: When the collection of syllables that teaches the meaning of the dhāraṇī is called “dhāraṇī” here, then it is understood as the essence that expresses the meaning of this dhāraṇī of accomplishing the infinite door.

original: de yang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa nyid de /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa nyid de /
translated: And that is the recollection of the Buddha.

original: de thob pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: de thob pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'am /
translated: Its attainment is the attainment of the bodhisattva who has arisen from hearing,

original: bsams pa las byung ba'am /
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'am /
translated: or from reflection,

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba chung du'am /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba chung du'am /
translated: or from meditation, whether small,

original: 'bring ngam / chen po'am /
analyzed: 'bring ngam / chen po'am /
translated: medium, or great,

original: gcig pu'am / gnyis sam /🔽mtha' dag gis thob pa'i byang chub sems dpar gyur pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pu'am / gnyis sam / mtha' dag gis thob pa'i byang chub sems dpar gyur pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: whether one, two,🔽or all of them.

original: sems can rnams la byang chub kyi rnam par bsgom pas na /
analyzed: sems can rnams la byang chub kyi rnam par bsgom pas na /
translated: They are bodhisattvas because they cultivate the aspect of enlightenment in sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams te /
translated: They are bodhisattvas.

original: de dag ni gzungs thob pas sems can thams cad la stong pa nyid kyi rnam par sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de dag ni gzungs thob pas sems can thams cad la stong pa nyid kyi rnam par sgom par byed do //
translated: They are irreversible because they have attained retention and meditate on emptiness for all sentient beings.

original: yang na sems dpa'i sgra ni dngos por bstan par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na sems dpa'i sgra ni dngos por bstan par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Or else, the word “bodhisattva” should be understood as referring to a real entity.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni phyir mi ldog par mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni phyir mi ldog par mtshungs so //
translated: All of them are alike in being irreversible.

original: phyir ldog pa ni phyir nur ba ste /
analyzed: phyir ldog pa ni phyir nur ba ste /
translated: Reversal is turning back.

original: 'khor ba dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu ltung ba'o //🔽de yod pa dag ni phyir ldog pa'o //🔽phyir ldog pa ma yin pa @29a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i byang chub tu ltung ba'o // de yod pa dag ni phyir ldog pa'o // phyir ldog pa ma yin pa @29a * //
translated: It is falling back into the lifecycle and into the enlightenment of the śrāvaka etc.🔽Those who have it are “irreversible”.

original: dag ni / phyir mi ldog pa dag ste /
analyzed: dag ni / phyir mi ldog pa dag ste /
translated: Those who do not have it are “reversible”.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are irreversible because they are destined for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i dus la ni bye brag yod de /
analyzed: de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob pa'i dus la ni bye brag yod de /
translated: They differ in the time it takes them to attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di ltar gang dag thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa chen pos gzungs kyi don thob pa de dag gi byang chub 'thob pa'i dus ni ring ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa chen pos gzungs kyi don thob pa de dag gi byang chub 'thob pa'i dus ni ring ba'o //
translated: Thus, the time of attaining enlightenment for those who have attained the meaning of dhāraṇī through the great knowledge that arises from hearing is long.

original: 'bring gis thob pa gang yin pa de dag ni shin tu ring ba'o //
analyzed: 'bring gis thob pa gang yin pa de dag ni shin tu ring ba'o //
translated: For those who have attained it through the medium, it is very long.

original: chung ngus thob pa gang yin pa de dag ni ches shin tu ring ba'o //
analyzed: chung ngus thob pa gang yin pa de dag ni ches shin tu ring ba'o //
translated: For those who have attained it through the small, it is extremely long.

original: de bzhin du bsams pa las byung ba la sogs pa la yang mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsams pa las byung ba la sogs pa la yang mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be applied in the same way to the knowledge that arises from reflection and so on.

original: myur ba'i tshig gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: myur ba'i tshig gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The word quickly that was stated

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi don thob pa dag las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de dag gis byang chub 'thob pa'i dus la ltos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzungs kyi don thob pa dag las gzhan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de dag gis byang chub 'thob pa'i dus la ltos par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be known as referring to the time of attaining enlightenment for those bodhisattvas who are other than those bodhisattvas who have attained the meaning of dhāraṇī.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba des ni gtan tshigs dri ba bstan te /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba des ni gtan tshigs dri ba bstan te /
translated: Why is that? This shows the question about the reason.

original: gtan tshigs sh'a ri'i bu 'dir zhes bka' stsal ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i gzungs zhes bya ba dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs sh'a ri'i bu 'dir zhes bka' stsal ba ni dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i gzungs zhes bya ba dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: The reason is stated: “Śāriputra, here” is connected with the dhāraṇī called “the practice of the absence of apprehension.”

original: dmigs pa thams cad yod min pa //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad yod min pa //
translated: All apprehensions do not exist.

original: 'dir ni dmigs pa med par bsgrags //
analyzed: 'dir ni dmigs pa med par bsgrags //
translated: Here, the absence of apprehension is proclaimed.

original: dmigs pa yod pa ma yin phyir//
analyzed: dmigs pa yod pa ma yin phyir//
translated: Because the apprehension does not exist,

original: dmigs pa med pa'ang rigs ldan min //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'ang rigs ldan min //
translated: the absence of apprehension is also not reasonable.

original: dngos po dmigs pa med pa dag la dmigs pa ni dmigs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: dngos po dmigs pa med pa dag la dmigs pa ni dmigs pa thams cad de /
translated: The apprehension of things that are not apprehended is all apprehensions.

original: de med pa gang yin pa de la ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis dmigs pa med pa zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de med pa gang yin pa de la ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis dmigs pa med pa zhes bstan te /
translated: The absence of that is taught here by the Blessed One as the absence of apprehension.

original: dmigs par bya ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is nothing to be apprehended,

original: dmigs pa med pa tsam du zad pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa tsam du zad pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: it is not just the mere absence of apprehension.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir /🔽dmigs pa med pa yang /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i phyir / dmigs pa med pa yang /
translated: Because there is no apprehension,🔽the absence of apprehension

original: yang dag par na mi dmigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: yang dag par na mi dmigs pa kho na ste /
translated: is also not apprehended in reality.

original: dgag par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽gang tshe 'di la dmigs med pa'i //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro // gang tshe 'di la dmigs med pa'i //
translated: Because there is nothing to be refuted.🔽When there is the great practice

original: spyod pa chen po yod gyur na //
analyzed: spyod pa chen po yod gyur na //
translated: of the absence of apprehension here,

original: de nyid yang dag shes de'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid yang dag shes de'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, it is right knowledge.

original: de la mi 'grub ci zhig yod //
analyzed: de la mi 'grub ci zhig yod //
translated: What is not accomplished by it?

original: spyod pa ni sngar bstan pa'i dmigs pa med pas so //
analyzed: spyod pa ni sngar bstan pa'i dmigs pa med pas so //
translated: The practice is due to the absence of the object as previously taught.

original: chen po ni yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs mtha' yas pa sdud pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po ni yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs mtha' yas pa sdud pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is great because it includes the infinite varieties of virtues.

original: de nyid mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: It is right knowledge because it is non-deceptive.

original: gang gi tshe 'di la yod pa de ni dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di la yod pa de ni dmigs pa med pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: When it exists for one, then one has the practice of the absence of the object.

original: de lta bu'i gzungs @29b de las ci zhig 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzungs @29b de las ci zhig 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: What is not accomplished by that dhāraṇī?

original: thams cad kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽khyod kyis nyes pa ma lus pa //
analyzed: thams cad kyang 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // khyod kyis nyes pa ma lus pa //
translated: The meaning is that everything is accomplished.🔽You should remember the Buddha

original: spang ba sangs rgyas rjes dran nyid //
analyzed: spang ba sangs rgyas rjes dran nyid //
translated: in order to eliminate all faults.

original: de yi gnyen po yin pas na //
analyzed: de yi gnyen po yin pas na //
translated: Since that is the antidote,

original: de phyir ci bder sgoms par gyis //
analyzed: de phyir ci bder sgoms par gyis //
translated: therefore, meditate on it as much as you like.

original: de phyir 'dir sangs rgyas kyi chos dang yon tan thams cad kyi gter nges pa ste /
analyzed: de phyir 'dir sangs rgyas kyi chos dang yon tan thams cad kyi gter nges pa ste /
translated: Therefore, here, the treasure of all the qualities and virtues of the Buddha is ascertained.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni thun mong ma yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni thun mong ma yin pa rnams so //
translated: The qualities of a buddha are the uncommon qualities.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ba'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rnams ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ba'am /
translated: The virtues of a buddha are either common to the sravakas and so on or

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kho na'o //🔽gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs ba ni yon tan rnams te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kho na'o // gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs ba ni yon tan rnams te /
translated: they are the qualities of a buddha alone.

original: goms par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The powers of the knowledge of the possible and impossible and so on are the virtues because they are to be cultivated.

original: de dag gi gter ni rgyu ste nges pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gter ni rgyu ste nges pa'o //
translated: The treasure of those is the cause, the certainty.

original: yang de na sangs rgyas kyi chos dang yon tan thams cad yod pas na sangs rgyas kyi chos dang yon tan thams cad kyi gter te /
analyzed: yang de na sangs rgyas kyi chos dang yon tan thams cad yod pas na sangs rgyas kyi chos dang yon tan thams cad kyi gter te /
translated: Moreover, since all the qualities and virtues of a buddha exist there, it is the treasure of all the qualities and virtues of a buddha.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is the transcendent wisdom of omniscience.

original: de nges pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos dang yon tan thams cad kyi gter nges pa'o //
analyzed: de nges pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos dang yon tan thams cad kyi gter nges pa'o //
translated: Its certainty is the certainty of the treasure of all the qualities and virtues of a buddha.

original: gang gi phyir chos kyi nyes pa ma lus pa spong ba ni de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos kyi nyes pa ma lus pa spong ba ni de'i gnyen por gyur pa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa kho na yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since the recollection of the Buddha alone is the antidote to the relinquishment of all the faults of the Dharma,

original: khyod kyis ci bder sgoms shig ces bya bar bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs te 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can la /
analyzed: khyod kyis ci bder sgoms shig ces bya bar bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs te 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni dngos po la mngon par zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can la /
translated: The Lord thought, “You should meditate on whatever is comfortable,” and thus he thought that the obscurations of the afflictions such as attachment are preceded by the adherence to things.

original: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yang shes bya'i sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po la mngon par zhen pa yang shes bya'i sgrib pa yin te /
translated: The adherence to things is also the obscuration of the knowable.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas de spong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas de spong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The mindfulness of the Buddha eliminates that through the nature of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yid la goms pa'i mi la ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis ka yang mi gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yid la goms pa'i mi la ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis ka yang mi gnas so //
translated: Therefore, for one who is habituated to the mindfulness of the Buddha, neither of the two obscurations, the afflictive and the knowledge obscurations, remain.

original: 'di ltar gang la gang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa'i shas che ba yod pa de la de med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la gang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa'i shas che ba yod pa de la de med de /
translated: Thus, wherever there is a predominance of the suppression of the discordant side, there is no discordant side.

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho na me lce'i tshogs med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho na me lce'i tshogs med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as there is no mass of fire in the ocean,

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yid la goms pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa'i shas che ba yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa yid la goms pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis gnon pa'i shas che ba yod do //
translated: The recollection of the Buddha has a predominance of the suppression of the resistances to the elimination of the afflictions and the elimination of the knowable.

original: rigs par rjes su sgrub pas myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba @30a * //
analyzed: rigs par rjes su sgrub pas myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba @30a * //
translated: By means of the practice of reason, one quickly realizes the supreme enlightenment.

original: 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only that,

original: 'di ni rgyu nye bar gnas pas kyang khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'di nyid las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyi bye brag mchog 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu nye bar gnas pas kyang khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'di nyid las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyi bye brag mchog 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: because the cause is present, one should understand that in this very life one attains the supreme excellence of all the bodhisattvas’ practices.

original: bye brag phul du phyin pa ni bye brag mchog ste /
analyzed: bye brag phul du phyin pa ni bye brag mchog ste /
translated: Supreme excellence is the highest distinction.

original: 'di ltar 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i phyir //
translated: Thus, because of the purity of the three spheres,🔽one is endowed with the supreme of all practices,

original: sbyin pa la sogs mchog dang ldan //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs mchog dang ldan //
translated: generosity, etc.,

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyu'i //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub rgyu'i //
translated: the cause of perfect complete enlightenment.

original: khyad par 'di las 'thob par 'gyur //🔽sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: khyad par 'di las 'thob par 'gyur // sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs pas /
translated: This is the special attainment.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ni de yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ni de yin te /
translated: The purity of generosity and so forth is due to the non-apprehension of the object given, the giver, and the receiver.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the stain of its opposite.

original: des shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa spyod pa'i mtshan nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi byed rgyu 'di nyid las thob bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa spyod pa'i mtshan nyid bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi byed rgyu 'di nyid las thob bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From this very cause of enlightenment, which is characterized by the practice of generosity and so forth that is extremely exalted, one attains the unsurpassed.

original: de ltar 'thad pa dang bcas pa'i phan yon bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'thad pa dang bcas pa'i phan yon bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the benefits along with their feasibility,

original: phan yon gzhan yang gsungs te /
analyzed: phan yon gzhan yang gsungs te /
translated: he states another benefit:

original: 'dir ni thub pa'i dbang po yis //🔽yi ge'i don dang gnyi ga yi //
analyzed: 'dir ni thub pa'i dbang po yis // yi ge'i don dang gnyi ga yi //
translated: Here, the Lord of Sages🔽has taught the benefits of the dhāraṇīs

original: gzungs kyi phan yon bka' stsal te //
analyzed: gzungs kyi phan yon bka' stsal te //
translated: in terms of the meaning of the syllables and both,

original: ci rigs par ni sbyar bar zad //
analyzed: ci rigs par ni sbyar bar zad //
translated: applying them as appropriate.

original: yang na phan yon thams cad kyang //
analyzed: yang na phan yon thams cad kyang //
translated: Or, all the benefits

original: gzungs rnams kun la bshad bya ste //
analyzed: gzungs rnams kun la bshad bya ste //
translated: should be explained for all the dhāraṇīs,

original: kha cig dag ni dus gzhan las //
analyzed: kha cig dag ni dus gzhan las //
translated: but some are for other times,

original: dgongs pa tsam du zad pa yin //
analyzed: dgongs pa tsam du zad pa yin //
translated: It is only a thought.

original: yi ge'i gzungs ni gzungs kyi don ston pa'i yi ge ste /
analyzed: yi ge'i gzungs ni gzungs kyi don ston pa'i yi ge ste /
translated: The letter dhāraṇī is the letters that teach the meaning of dhāraṇī.

original: khar ba bsad pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: khar ba bsad pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the letters of the alphabet.

original: don gyi gzungs ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi gzungs ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: The meaning dhāraṇī is the recollection of the Buddha.

original: gnyi ga'i gzungs ni gnyis po de nyid do //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i gzungs ni gnyis po de nyid do //
translated: The double dhāraṇī is both of those.

original: gzungs rnam pa gsum bo 'di dag gi phan yon ni //
analyzed: gzungs rnam pa gsum bo 'di dag gi phan yon ni //
translated: The benefits of these three kinds of dhāraṇī

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis spyir bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis spyir bka' stsal to //
translated: are taught in general by the Blessed One here.

original: skyes bu shes pa dang ldan pas ci rigs par sbyar bar bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: skyes bu shes pa dang ldan pas ci rigs par sbyar bar bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: They are to be applied by the wise as appropriate.

original: yang na phan yon thams cad kyang gzungs thams cad kyi yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na phan yon thams cad kyang gzungs thams cad kyi yin par gsungs so //
translated: Or else, all the benefits are said to be those of all the dhāraṇīs.

original: bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: But there are also distinctions.

original: kha cig tu ni dus gzhan la dgongs par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni dus gzhan la dgongs par bshad par bya ste /
translated: In some cases, the intention is to be explained as referring to another time.🔽Thus:

original: 'di ltar / mnyam nyid ces bya dus dang don //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mnyam nyid ces bya dus dang don //
translated: Equality, time, and meaning,

original: gang zag gzhan zhes bya ba yi //🔽dgongs pa rnams kyis thub pa'i gsung //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan zhes bya ba yi // dgongs pa rnams kyis thub pa'i gsung //
translated: and the other person,🔽these are the intentions

original: ci rigs par ni rtogs par bya //
analyzed: ci rigs par ni rtogs par bya //
translated: of the Sage’s words, to be understood as appropriate.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni rnam pa bzhir khong du chud par bya @30b ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa ni rnam pa bzhir khong du chud par bya @30b ste /
translated: The intention of the Lord should be understood as fourfold.

original: mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The intention of sameness is

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis nga nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis nga nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: as when the Lord said, “I myself will not pass into final nirvāṇa.”

original: don gzhan la dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don gzhan la dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The intention of another meaning is

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la bsnyen bkur byas nas gdod theg pa chen po ston pa'i mchog tu zab mo'i don rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la bsnyen bkur byas nas gdod theg pa chen po ston pa'i mchog tu zab mo'i don rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: as when the Lord said, “Having served buddhas equal to the sands of the Ganges river, one will understand the meaning of the profound, the teaching of the Great Vehicle.”

original: gang zag gzhan la dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: gang zag gzhan la dgongs pa zhes bya ba ni / ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The intention of another time is

original: sbyin pa yis ni dga' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sbyin pa yis ni dga' bar 'gyur //
translated: as when the Lord said, “Through giving, one becomes happy.”🔽The intention of another person is

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas /
translated: as when the Lord said, “Those who are not vessels should not be taught the Mahāyāna.”

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsngags pa brjod par mdzad nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsngags pa brjod par mdzad nas /
translated: Having praised generosity and so on,

original: yang gang zag kha cig la brten te /
analyzed: yang gang zag kha cig la brten te /
translated: the Buddha, in dependence on certain persons,🔽disparaged those very things, generosity and so on, with statements such as:🔽Those who give gifts and are mutually dependent

original: sbyin pa sbyin pas phan tshun dag tu brten de dag / gzhan dang gzhan la gus par mi 'gyur bas //
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin pas phan tshun dag tu brten de dag / gzhan dang gzhan la gus par mi 'gyur bas //
translated: will not respect others and others will not respect them.

original: sangs rgyas mkhas pa bag chags spangs rnams ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mkhas pa bag chags spangs rnams ni //
translated: The wise Buddhas, who have abandoned latent propensities,

original: de 'drar brten pa de dag bsngags mi mdzad //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag nyid smod par mdzad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de 'drar brten pa de dag bsngags mi mdzad // ces bya ba la sogs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag nyid smod par mdzad pa lta bu'o //
translated: do not praise such mutual dependence.

original: dgongs pa bzhi po 'di dag gis thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab kyi mdud pa'i gnad rnams bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa bzhi po 'di dag gis thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab kyi mdud pa'i gnad rnams bshad par bya'o //
translated: These four intentions should be used to explain the essential points of the knots in the scriptures of the Lord of Sages.

original: dgongs pa bstan pa'i dgos pa ni yi ge mangs su dogs pas ma bshad do //
analyzed: dgongs pa bstan pa'i dgos pa ni yi ge mangs su dogs pas ma bshad do //
translated: I do not explain the purpose of teaching the intentions here for fear of being verbose.

original: skabs 'dir kha cig tu ni dus gzhan la dgongs te phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: skabs 'dir kha cig tu ni dus gzhan la dgongs te phan yon bstan to //
translated: In some contexts, the Buddha taught benefits with another time in mind.

original: gang zag gzhan la dgongs pas kyang bstan te /
analyzed: gang zag gzhan la dgongs pas kyang bstan te /
translated: He also taught with the intention of other persons.

original: de ni gsal ba'i phyir bdag gis ma sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni gsal ba'i phyir bdag gis ma sbyar ro //
translated: Since this is clear, I will not elaborate.

original: gzungs zhes bya 'dir kha cig tu //🔽mgon po thugs rje can gyis ni //
analyzed: gzungs zhes bya 'dir kha cig tu // mgon po thugs rje can gyis ni //
translated: In some places, this dhāraṇī

original: gzungs zhes pa ni chen po yi //
analyzed: gzungs zhes pa ni chen po yi //
translated: is called the great dhāraṇī

original: chen po'ang yin par bka' stsal to //
analyzed: chen po'ang yin par bka' stsal to //
translated: by the compassionate Lord.

original: gzungs la dmigs pa shes rab kyi mtha' la gnas pa la gzungs zhes bya bar /
analyzed: gzungs la dmigs pa shes rab kyi mtha' la gnas pa la gzungs zhes bya bar /
translated: The dhāraṇī is called the dhāraṇī of the perfection of wisdom that abides in the limit of reality.

original: sems can gyi don la mkhas pa bcom ldan 'das kyis kha cig tu gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la mkhas pa bcom ldan 'das kyis kha cig tu gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavān has taught the skill in the benefit of sentient beings in some places.

original: mi sdug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi sdug pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the meditation on the unattractive.

original: de ltar don bsdus pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar don bsdus pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the summary,

original: da ni de'i phan yon gyi tshigs su bcad pa so sor brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de'i phan yon gyi tshigs su bcad pa so sor brtag par bya ste /
translated: now the benefits of that should be examined verse by verse.

original: ci 'di dag stong pa nyid yin nam 'on te ma yin snyam du /
analyzed: ci 'di dag stong pa nyid yin nam 'on te ma yin snyam du /
translated: What are these? Are they emptiness or not?

original: chos rnams stong par dogs med cing /
analyzed: chos rnams stong par dogs med cing /
translated: Without doubt, all phenomena are empty.

original: mdo sde 'di thos na @31a * //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di thos na @31a * //
translated: If one hears this sūtra,

original: stong pa kho na'o snyam du sems te /
analyzed: stong pa kho na'o snyam du sems te /
translated: one thinks, They are indeed empty.

original: 'di ni the tshom med pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni the tshom med pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: This shows the benefit of being without doubt.

original: chos rnams stong pa la //
analyzed: chos rnams stong pa la //
translated: In the emptiness of phenomena,

original: byang chub ched du spros mi byed //
analyzed: byang chub ched du spros mi byed //
translated: one should not proliferate for the sake of enlightenment.

original: chos rnams dang byang chub kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams dang byang chub kyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because phenomena and awakening are essenceless.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub 'thob po snyam du dmigs pa ni spros pa'o//
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub 'thob po snyam du dmigs pa ni spros pa'o//
translated: To think, “These will attain awakening,” is conceptual elaboration.

original: 'dis ni dmigs pa med pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dmigs pa med pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: This shows the benefit of nonapprehending.

original: chos dbyings 'khrug par mi byed na //
analyzed: chos dbyings 'khrug par mi byed na //
translated: Not disturbing the realm of phenomena,

original: chos kyi dbyings 'khrug pa ni phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings 'khrug pa ni phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: Disturbing the realm of phenomena is the mistaken adherence to it.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings ni yang dag par stong pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings ni yang dag par stong pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Thus, the realm of phenomena is neither really empty nor not empty.

original: mi stong pa'ang ma yin na /
analyzed: mi stong pa'ang ma yin na /
translated: How could it be apprehended as empty or not empty?

original: de la stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa ni 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa ni 'khrug pa'o //
translated: To apprehend it as having the nature of emptiness and so on is to disturb it.

original: 'dis ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag par khong du chud pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag par khong du chud pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: This shows the benefit of fully understanding the essence of the realm of phenomena.

original: de phyir gzungs ni 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir gzungs ni 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, one attains the dhāraṇīs.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni don gyi gzungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni don gyi gzungs te /
translated: This is the dhāraṇī of meaning.

original: 'di ni yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon dngos dang brgyad pa'i bye brag gis bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon dngos dang brgyad pa'i bye brag gis bstan to //
translated: This shows the benefit of the dhāraṇī of letters through the distinction of the actual and the eighth.

original: yang na phan yon 'di ni gzungs rnam pa gsum char la yang mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na phan yon 'di ni gzungs rnam pa gsum char la yang mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Or else, this benefit is to be applied in the appropriate way to all three kinds of retention.

original: gang gi tshe don gyi gzungs kyi phan yon du bstan pa de'i tshe ni gzungs smos pas rab kyi mtha' la gnas pa'i gzungs kyi ye shes gzung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe don gyi gzungs kyi phan yon du bstan pa de'i tshe ni gzungs smos pas rab kyi mtha' la gnas pa'i gzungs kyi ye shes gzung ngo //
translated: When the benefit of the retention of meaning is taught, then by mentioning retention, the knowledge retention of the peak of the word is retained.

original: mdo sde 'di ni mnyan par bya ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon rnam pa gsum dus gzhan la dgongs pa'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di ni mnyan par bya ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon rnam pa gsum dus gzhan la dgongs pa'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: By this statement, “this sutra is to be listened to,” the benefit of the retention of the letter is taught in terms of three aspects and a future time.

original: gzungs 'thob pa dang / ye shes 'byor pa 'thob pa dang byang chub 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs 'thob pa dang / ye shes 'byor pa 'thob pa dang byang chub 'thob pa'o //
translated: The attainment of retention, the attainment of the wealth of knowledge, and the attainment of enlightenment.

original: yang na gang gi tshe /
analyzed: yang na gang gi tshe /
translated: Or else, when it is said,

original: 'di la gzungs ni zad pa med //
analyzed: 'di la gzungs ni zad pa med //
translated: “The retention here is inexhaustible,”

original: ces brjod par bya zhes bya ba lhag ma yin pa de'i che na gzungs smos pa mngon sum gyi phan yon yin la /
analyzed: ces brjod par bya zhes bya ba lhag ma yin pa de'i che na gzungs smos pa mngon sum gyi phan yon yin la /
translated: then the retention mentioned is the benefit of direct perception,

original: gzhan gnyis po ni dus gzhan dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gnyis po ni dus gzhan dgongs pa'o //
translated: while the other two are the benefit of a future time.

original: yang na gzungs rnam pa gsum char gyi phan yon yin te /
analyzed: yang na gzungs rnam pa gsum char gyi phan yon yin te /
translated: Or else, it is the benefit of all three kinds of retention.

original: yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The benefit of the dhāraṇī of letters is threefold.

original: don gyi gzungs kyi ni rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: don gyi gzungs kyi ni rnam gnyis so //
translated: The benefit of the dhāraṇī of meaning is twofold.

original: ye shes kyi gzungs kyi ni gcig tu bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi gzungs kyi ni gcig tu bstan to //
translated: The benefit of the dhāraṇī of intuition is taught as one.

original: yon tan zad pa med pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan zad pa med pa'i phyir mi zad pa'o //
translated: It is inexhaustible because its virtues are inexhaustible.

original: gzungs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: gzungs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: By the dhāraṇī, etc.,

original: yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon dus gzhan la dgongs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
analyzed: yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon dus gzhan la dgongs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis su bstan te /
translated: the benefit of the dhāraṇī of letters is taught as twofold, in terms of its intention for another time.

original: stong pa nyid dang / 'tsho ba med pa dang / tshigs su bcad @31b pa med pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa dang / phyogs bcur rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos bstan pa thos pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / 'tsho ba med pa dang / tshigs su bcad @31b pa med pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa dang / phyogs bcur rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos bstan pa thos pa'o //
translated: It is fearless because it is free from all fear of emptiness, lack of livelihood, lack of verse, etc., and it hears the teaching of the Dharma of the Buddhas dwelling in the ten directions.

original: gzung ba ni ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba ni ma brjed pa'o //
translated: Retention is non-forgetting.

original: don gyi gzungs kyi ni phan yon de gnyi ga mngon sum kho na'i yin te /
analyzed: don gyi gzungs kyi ni phan yon de gnyi ga mngon sum kho na'i yin te /
translated: The benefit of the dhāraṇī of meaning is both of these, but only in terms of direct perception.

original: gzung ba ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: Retention is cultivation.

original: mchog gi chos zhes bya ba 'dis ni dus gzhan la dgongs pa'i sgo nas yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon du bstan to //
analyzed: mchog gi chos zhes bya ba 'dis ni dus gzhan la dgongs pa'i sgo nas yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon du bstan to //
translated: This supreme Dharma indicates the benefit of the letter-dhāraṇī from the perspective of its future intention.

original: cig shos kyis ni mngon sum gyi phan yon du bstan to //
analyzed: cig shos kyis ni mngon sum gyi phan yon du bstan to //
translated: The other all meanings indicates the benefit of the letter-dhāraṇī from the perspective of its present direct realization.

original: 'dis ni so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bzhi thob par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni so so yang dag par rig pa rnam pa bzhi thob par bstan te /
translated: This shows the attainment of the four types of analytical knowledges.

original: de la mchog gi chos zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: de la mchog gi chos zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: Among them, supreme Dharma

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa bstan to //
translated: shows the analytical knowledge of dharmas.

original: don thams cad ces smos pas ni don so so yang dag par rig pa bstan to //
analyzed: don thams cad ces smos pas ni don so so yang dag par rig pa bstan to //
translated: By mentioning all meanings, it shows the analytical knowledge of meanings.

original: tshig 'bru thams cad ces smos pas ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshig 'bru thams cad ces smos pas ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa bstan to //
translated: By mentioning all words, it shows the analytical knowledge of language.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer ji snyed pa //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer ji snyed pa //
translated: As many as the sun's rays,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni /🔽spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bstan te /
translated: and so on,🔽it shows the analytical knowledge of eloquence.

original: mchog smos pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs can gyi so so yang dag par rig pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog smos pa ni sangs rgyas kyi rigs can gyi so so yang dag par rig pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of supreme is to show the analytical knowledge of those belonging to the Buddha lineage.

original: don dang tshig 'brus bskyod kun gyi //
analyzed: don dang tshig 'brus bskyod kun gyi //
translated: All the world’s movements of meaning and expression

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig ni /
translated: The words “all the world’s movements of meaning and expression”

original: de dag gis chos so so yang dag par rig par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis chos so so yang dag par rig par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: indicate the knowledge of Dharma, because it is the entrance to the knowledge of Dharma.

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi dpe ni mtha' yas pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi dpe ni mtha' yas pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The example of the sun’s rays shows the infinity of the knowledge of Dharma.

original: tshig smos pa ni tshig dang tshig gi don gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig smos pa ni tshig dang tshig gi don gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “expression” is used because it includes both the words and their meanings.

original: yang na mchog gi chos stong pa nyid kyi chos rnam par shes so //
analyzed: yang na mchog gi chos stong pa nyid kyi chos rnam par shes so //
translated: Alternatively, the “supreme Dharma” is the Dharma of emptiness, which is understood.

original: don thams cad ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: don thams cad ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: All “meanings” are emptiness,

original: de ni dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the essence of all things.

original: de tshig gang dag gis gsal bar byed pa de dag gis bskyod de /🔽'jug par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de tshig gang dag gis gsal bar byed pa de dag gis bskyod de / 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those words by which it is expressed are “all the world’s movements of expression.”🔽They are the entrance to the knowledge of Dharma.

original: tshig 'bru smos pas ni tshig rnams bstan to //
analyzed: tshig 'bru smos pas ni tshig rnams bstan to //
translated: The word “expression” indicates the words.

original: 'di'i rgyu bstan pa ni ji snyed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rgyu bstan pa ni ji snyed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of that knowledge is shown by the words “all the world’s movements of meaning and expression.”

original: yang na mchog gi chos ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: yang na mchog gi chos ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: Alternatively, the “supreme Dharma” is the supramundane Dharma.

original: tshig 'bru gang dag la mchog gi chos dang don thams cad yod pa de dag gis bskyod de 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig 'bru gang dag la mchog gi chos dang don thams cad yod pa de dag gis bskyod de 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who have the supreme Dharma and all meanings in their words are shaken by them and made to enter. This is the meaning.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'dis kyang so so yang dag par rig pa rnams 'thob par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang so so yang dag par rig pa rnams 'thob par bstan to //
translated: This also shows the attainment of the analytical knowledges.

original: gang dag chos kyi mchog 'gyur ba /🔽de dag @32a * //
analyzed: gang dag chos kyi mchog 'gyur ba / de dag @32a * //
translated: Those who have the supreme Dharma🔽They are

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: It is said:

original: rlabs chen gzungs kyi sgo rnams te //
analyzed: rlabs chen gzungs kyi sgo rnams te //
translated: The doors of vast dhāraṇīs

original: gang zhig mdo 'di 'dzin de la //
analyzed: gang zhig mdo 'di 'dzin de la //
translated: For those who uphold this sūtra,

original: thams cad rtag tu mngon du 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad rtag tu mngon du 'gyur //
translated: All will always manifest.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is said

original: dus gzhan la dgongs pa'i sgo nas de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: dus gzhan la dgongs pa'i sgo nas de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: with the intention of referring to another time.

original: gal te sems can thams cad kyis //
analyzed: gal te sems can thams cad kyis //
translated: If all sentient beings

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phan yon 'di dngos dang brgyud pa'i sgo nas gzungs rnam pa gsum char gyi yang yin par gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phan yon 'di dngos dang brgyud pa'i sgo nas gzungs rnam pa gsum char gyi yang yin par gsungs so //
translated: and so on, this benefit is said to be of the three kinds of dhāraṇīs, both directly and indirectly.

original: de yi ye shes mi zad do //
analyzed: de yi ye shes mi zad do //
translated: His wisdom is inexhaustible.

original: zhes bya ba 'di rgyu'i tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di rgyu'i tshig go //
translated: This is a causal statement.

original: bskal pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bskal pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mention of eons is for the sake of illustration.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa dag kyang gzung bar bya'o //🔽mdo sde 'di la su dga' ba //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa dag kyang gzung bar bya'o // mdo sde 'di la su dga' ba //
translated: One should understand that countless eons are also to be taken.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who delight in this discourse🔽.

original: de la dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they possess faith, etc.

original: 'dis ni yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon dus gzhan la dgongs pa'i sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni yi ge'i gzungs kyi phan yon dus gzhan la dgongs pa'i sgo nas bstan to //
translated: This shows the benefit of the letter-dhâraî, intending a different time.

original: don gyi gzungs kyi ni mngon sum du byas pas mdo sde la dga' bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir don gyi gzungs kyi yang 'dir bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi gzungs kyi ni mngon sum du byas pas mdo sde la dga' bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir don gyi gzungs kyi yang 'dir bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The benefit of the meaning-dhâraî is shown by the fact that one delights in the discourse. Therefore, one should understand that the meaning-dhâraî is also taught here.🔽He is the son of the Dharma King

original: de ni chos kyi rgyal po'i sras //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi rgyal po'i sras //
translated: He is the son of the Dharma King.🔽

original: zhes bya ba ni sa dang po thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sa dang po thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he attains the first stage.

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no //
translated: At that time, he is born into the family of the Tathâgatas.

original: byang chub mchog la nye ba yin //
analyzed: byang chub mchog la nye ba yin //
translated: He is close to supreme enlightenment🔽.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa la sogs pa'i sa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog pa la sogs pa'i sa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he attains the stage of nonregression, etc.

original: yid brtan pa ni de kho na'i ye shes skyes pas mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid brtan pa ni de kho na'i ye shes skyes pas mi slu ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reliable because it is non-deceptive, since the intuition of reality has arisen.

original: chos kyang 'dzin zhes bya ba ni legs pa'i blo gros la sogs pa'i sa thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ma lus par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyang 'dzin zhes bya ba ni legs pa'i blo gros la sogs pa'i sa thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ma lus par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it holds the Dharma, because, by attaining the stages of Perfect Understanding, etc., it holds the entire Dharma of the Tathagatas.

original: de la sems can thams cad dga' //
analyzed: de la sems can thams cad dga' //
translated: It is pleasing to all sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis kyang gzungs rnam pa gsum char gyi phan yon bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis kyang gzungs rnam pa gsum char gyi phan yon bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: This also should be understood as the benefit of the three kinds of retention.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyang de la dgyes //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyang de la dgyes // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And the Buddhas rejoice in it.

original: de nged cag gis gces pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //🔽ci'i phyir / de ni 'chi ba'i dus byed tshe //
analyzed: de nged cag gis gces pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro // ci'i phyir / de ni 'chi ba'i dus byed tshe //
translated: Because they think, “He will be a holder of our Dharma.”

original: sangs rgyas bye ba brgyad cu mthong zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba brgyad cu mthong zhe na /
translated: Why is it that “at the time of death, he sees eight hundred million Buddhas”?

original: gsang sngags kyi tshig brgyad cu yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi tshig brgyad cu yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there are eighty dharani-mantras.

original: gsang sngags kyi tshig re re zhing yang sangs rgyas bye ba bye bas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi tshig re re zhing yang sangs rgyas bye ba bye bas byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each and every mantra is empowered by ten million buddhas.

original: yang na gzungs kyi mthu nyid 'di 'dra ste /
analyzed: yang na gzungs kyi mthu nyid 'di 'dra ste /
translated: Or else, the power of the dhāraṇī is like this:

original: des 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe sangs rgyas bye ba brgyad cu mthong ngo //
analyzed: des 'chi ba'i dus kyi tshe sangs rgyas bye ba brgyad cu mthong ngo //
translated: at the time of death, one sees eighty million buddhas.

original: lag pa de la nye bar 'jog / ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: lag pa de la nye bar 'jog / ces bya ba ni /
translated: “That hand is placed on them”

original: rigs kyi bu @32b ma 'jigs shig ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu @32b ma 'jigs shig ces bya ba'am /
translated: means “Son of noble family, do not be afraid!”

original: yang na nged kyi thad du shog ces bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na nged kyi thad du shog ces bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or “Come to us!”

original: su zhig mdo sde 'di 'dzin pa //
analyzed: su zhig mdo sde 'di 'dzin pa //
translated: “Whoever upholds this sūtra”

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni phan yon 'di yi ge'i gzungs kyi yin no bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni phan yon 'di yi ge'i gzungs kyi yin no bstan te /
translated: shows that this benefit is from the letter dhāraṇī.

original: shugs kyis na phan yon 'di don gyi gzungs kyi yang yin par nges par gzungs bar bya'o //
analyzed: shugs kyis na phan yon 'di don gyi gzungs kyi yang yin par nges par gzungs bar bya'o //
translated: By implication, it should be understood that this benefit is also from the meaning dhāraṇī.

original: bskal pa bye ba stong rnams su //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba stong rnams su //
translated: “For a thousand million eons”

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni phan yon 'di gzungs gsum char gyi yang yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni phan yon 'di gzungs gsum char gyi yang yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: shows that this benefit is from all three dhāraṇīs.

original: sgron mas skad cig gcig gis kyang dus ring po nas bsags pa'i mun pa sel bar mthong ba'i phyir bskal pa bye ba stong du bsags pa'i sdig pa zla ba gcig gis ji ltar 'byang bar 'gyur snyam du 'khrul pa bskyed par mi bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpas bsod nams gang //
analyzed: sgron mas skad cig gcig gis kyang dus ring po nas bsags pa'i mun pa sel bar mthong ba'i phyir bskal pa bye ba stong du bsags pa'i sdig pa zla ba gcig gis ji ltar 'byang bar 'gyur snyam du 'khrul pa bskyed par mi bya'o // byang chub sems dpas bsod nams gang //
translated: Since it is seen that the lamp dispels the darkness accumulated over a long time in an instant, one should not generate the confusion, “How could the misdeeds accumulated over a thousand eons be purified in a month?”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phan yon 'di don gyi gzungs kyi yin par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phan yon 'di don gyi gzungs kyi yin par bstan to //
translated: “Whatever merit bodhisattvas have…” and so forth teaches that this benefit is from the meaning dhāraṇī.

original: yi ge'i gzungs kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yi ge'i gzungs kyi ni ma yin te /
