analyzed: bsgom pa'i snga rol du bzlas brjod bya ba'i sgo nas ci nus su gsang sngags kyi tshig rnams brjod la /
translated: Before meditation, one should recite the mantra words as much as possible by way of repetition.

original: de'i 'og tu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, afterwards, one should meditate.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa //
translated: Because it is so,

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bye ba ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bye ba ni //
translated: therefore, eighty million buddhas

original: brgyad cus de la gzungs sbyin mdzad //
analyzed: brgyad cus de la gzungs sbyin mdzad //
translated: bestow the dhāraṇī upon him.

original: yang na dgu bcu las thos ltar //
analyzed: yang na dgu bcu las thos ltar //
translated: Or, as heard from ninety,

original: bsgoms mthu de ni 'di 'dra'o //
analyzed: bsgoms mthu de ni 'di 'dra'o //
translated: the power of meditation is like this.

original: yang na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom pa'i mthu nyid 'di 'dra ste /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgom pa'i mthu nyid 'di 'dra ste /
translated: Or, the power of cultivating the recollection of the Buddha is like this.

original: des sangs rgyas bye ba @34b phrag brgyad cus de la gzungs sbyin par mdzad do //
analyzed: des sangs rgyas bye ba @34b phrag brgyad cus de la gzungs sbyin par mdzad do //
translated: By that, eighty million buddhas bestow the dhāraṇī upon him.

original: dper na 'di nyid las sangs rgyas bye ba phrag dgu bcu las chos bstan pa thos so zhes yang dang yang du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'di nyid las sangs rgyas bye ba phrag dgu bcu las chos bstan pa thos so zhes yang dang yang du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, as stated again and again in this very text, he hears the teachings of ninety million buddhas.

original: gzungs de rnam ba ji lta bur bsams na thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzungs de rnam ba ji lta bur bsams na thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If asked how that dhāraṇī is attained by contemplating it,🔽it is said:

original: smras pa / gzugs sogs bsam pa bsam nya yin //
analyzed: smras pa / gzugs sogs bsam pa bsam nya yin //
translated: The contemplation of form and so on is contemplation.

original: gzugs med sogs pa bsam bya min //
analyzed: gzugs med sogs pa bsam bya min //
translated: The formless, etc. are not to be reflected upon.

original: yang na sprul pa bsam bya yin //
analyzed: yang na sprul pa bsam bya yin //
translated: Or else, the emanation body is to be reflected upon.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa bsam nya min //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa bsam nya min //
translated: The beatific body is not to be reflected upon.

original: yang na bsam bya bsam bya min //
analyzed: yang na bsam bya bsam bya min //
translated: Or else, the object of reflection is not to be reflected upon.

original: bya bsam bya min dngos bsam bya //
analyzed: bya bsam bya min dngos bsam bya //
translated: The action is not to be reflected upon, but the entity is to be reflected upon.

original: gzod nas ma skyes pas med phyir //
analyzed: gzod nas ma skyes pas med phyir //
translated: Because of non-existence due to primordial non-production,

original: bsam pa de dag bsam mi bya //
analyzed: bsam pa de dag bsam mi bya //
translated: those reflections are not to be reflected upon.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la bsam pa ni bsam bya min pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la bsam pa ni bsam bya min pa ste /
translated: The reflection on form, etc. is not to be reflected upon.

original: de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo yin pas don gyi bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo yin pas don gyi bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that is the nature of non-existence, it does not perform the action of an object.

original: bsam par bya ba'i 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam par bya ba'i 'os ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not fit to be the object of reflection.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni mtshan la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams nyid gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni mtshan la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams nyid gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “etc.” refers to the previously mentioned characteristics, etc.

original: yang na sprul pa'i sku la bsam pa gang yin pa de ni bsam par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na sprul pa'i sku la bsam pa gang yin pa de ni bsam par bya ba yin te /
translated: Or else, that reflection which is on the emanation body is to be reflected upon.

original: de ni skye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis bsam par bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis bsam par bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is capable of being reflected upon by means of the distinctions of birth, etc.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la bsam pa gang yin pa de ni bsam par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku la bsam pa gang yin pa de ni bsam par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: That which is to be imagined with regard to the Enjoyment Body is not to be imagined.

original: de ni skye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis bsam par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skye ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis bsam par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not possible to imagine it with regard to birth, etc.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang bsam par bya ba bsam par nus pa'i dngos po la bsam pa gang yin pa de ni bsam par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang bsam par bya ba bsam par nus pa'i dngos po la bsam pa gang yin pa de ni bsam par bya ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, that which is to be imagined is an entity that can be imagined.

original: bsam par bya ba ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi chos la sogs pa dag la bsam pa yin pa de ni bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam par bya ba ma yin pa sangs rgyas kyi chos la sogs pa dag la bsam pa yin pa de ni bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is not to be imagined is the Buddha qualities, etc.

original: gzod ma nas ma skyes pas gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes pas gzugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because form, etc. do not exist, since they are not produced from the beginning,

original: bsam pa de dag ni bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa de dag ni bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: those imaginations are not to be imagined.

original: ji ltar chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pa de lta na sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pa de lta na sngar bstan zin to //
translated: As all things are not produced from the beginning, that has already been taught.

original: 'o na ci zhig soms shig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig soms shig ce na /
translated: But what is to be imagined?

original: smras pa chos kyi dbyings soms shig / de la yang log par bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa chos kyi dbyings soms shig / de la yang log par bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: It is said: imagine the dharma-element, but do not imagine it wrongly.

original: chos kyi dbyings ji ltar bsam zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ji ltar bsam zhe na /
translated: How should one reflect on the dharma-dhātu?🔽One should not reflect on it as contradictory in any way.

original: ji ltar yang 'gal bar yang ma sems shig / ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'gal bar yang ma sems shig / ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar rnam pa gang dang gang gis chos kyi dbyings sems par byed pa rnams de dang de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa gang dang gang gis chos kyi dbyings sems par byed pa rnams de dang de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because whatever aspects one reflects on, they do not exist in that way.

original: stong pa dang / rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: stong pa dang / rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: Emptiness, the absence of intrinsic arising, etc.

original: don dam @35a * //
analyzed: don dam @35a * //
translated: are ultimately nonexistent,

original: par na dgag par bya ba med pa la dgag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: par na dgag par bya ba med pa la dgag pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir med pa kho na ste /
translated: because a negation does not apply to the absence of an object of negation.

original: de lta bas na chos kyi dbyings de la yang bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na chos kyi dbyings de la yang bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should not reflect on that dharma-dhātu,

original: log par bsam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: log par bsam par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which is to say, one should not reflect on it in a distorted way.

original: 'gal bar sems pa ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / dngos po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / dngos po tha dad pa nyid dang / gcig pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnam par sems pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal bar sems pa ni skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / dngos po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / dngos po tha dad pa nyid dang / gcig pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa rnam par sems pa ste /
translated: Distorted reflection is to reflect on aspects such as non-arising, and on aspects such as entity, as having the characteristic of being different entities and not being the same.

original: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to what is to be understood,🔽

original: gang stong pa nyid du lta ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid du lta ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: With reference to what was it said, Whoever views emptiness as real and so on?

original: rnal 'byor pas ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa kho nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa kho nas /
translated: The yogi, in the manner taught,

original: de ltar zhag bdun sems na ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhag bdun sems na ni /
translated: If he contemplates in this way for seven days,

original: de yi 'og tu gzungs thob 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi 'og tu gzungs thob 'gyur //
translated: After that, he will attain the dhāraṇī.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yang yang du bshad pas ci zhig bya snyam du dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yang yang du bshad pas ci zhig bya snyam du dgongs nas /
translated: Thinking, What is the point of the Blessed One's repeated explanations?,

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he said, For example, and so on.

original: phan yon 'di ni gzungs rnam pa gsum char gyi yin no //
analyzed: phan yon 'di ni gzungs rnam pa gsum char gyi yin no //
translated: This benefit is for all three types of dhāraṇīs.

original: bde ba ni nges par legs pa dang mngon par mtho ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni nges par legs pa dang mngon par mtho ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: Happiness is the happiness of definite goodness and higher rebirth.

original: som nyi ni the tshom za zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: som nyi ni the tshom za zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Doubt is what is meant by having doubts.

original: de ltar phan yon rnam pa du ma bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phan yon rnam pa du ma bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the many benefits,

original: 'bras bu nye ba gtso bo bstan pas 'dul ba'i 'jig rten gzungs 'di la 'jug cing mjug sdud par mdzad de /
analyzed: 'bras bu nye ba gtso bo bstan pas 'dul ba'i 'jig rten gzungs 'di la 'jug cing mjug sdud par mdzad de /
translated: he concludes by teaching the primary benefit that is close at hand, in order to engage the world that is to be disciplined in this dhāraṇī:

original: 'di las rdzogs pa'i byang chub nye //
analyzed: 'di las rdzogs pa'i byang chub nye //
translated: From this, perfect enlightenment is near.

original: de bas 'di la sbyor bar gyis //
analyzed: de bas 'di la sbyor bar gyis //
translated: Therefore, apply yourself to this!

original: thos pa la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'am /
translated: By means of learning, etc.,

original: lus la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'am /
translated: by means of the body, etc.,

original: 'og nas bzhi tshan bstan pa rnams kyis sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'og nas bzhi tshan bstan pa rnams kyis sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: and by means of the fourfold teaching that will be given below.

original: 'dis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: This shows the perfection of his own aim, which is twofold: the perfection of intuition and the perfection of abandonment,

original: byang chub ni ye shes dang spangs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub ni ye shes dang spangs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because enlightenment is characterized by intuition and abandonment.

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of intuition is fourfold:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / ma 'bad par mkhyen pa dang / ma bstan par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / ma 'bad par mkhyen pa dang / ma bstan par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: intuition of all things, intuition of all modes, effortless intuition, and unrequested intuition.

original: spangs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: spangs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of abandonment is fourfold:

original: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas par spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ste /
translated: The obscurations of the passions and of the knowable are abandoned, abandoned forever, abandoned along with their instincts, and all obscurations to samādhi and to meditative concentration are abandoned.

original: de dag kyang rdzogs pa'i byang chub smos pas bstan to//
analyzed: de dag kyang rdzogs pa'i byang chub smos pas bstan to//
translated: These are indicated by the word “enlightenment” in the above verse.

original: @35b khyed / zhi ba'i gnas ni thob gyur nas //
analyzed: @35b khyed / zhi ba'i gnas ni thob gyur nas //
translated: Having attained the state of peace,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob byed 'gyur //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob byed 'gyur //
translated: they will attain perfect enlightenment.

original: 'jig rten no snyam du dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten no snyam du dgongs pa ste /
translated: The thought is that they will attain the state of peace, the state of nirvana, for the sake of the world.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan par rig par bya'o //🔽zhi ba'i gnas ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ram /🔽me gsum zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan par rig par bya'o // zhi ba'i gnas ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ram / me gsum zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: By this verse the perfection of altruism is indicated.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The state of peace is the state of nirvana, which is nonabiding, because the obscurations of the passions and of the knowable are pacified, or because the three fires are pacified.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rnam pa gsum po ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni rnam pa gsum po ste /
translated: Perfect enlightenment is threefold:

original: 'dis ni byang chub gsum la 'god pa'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni byang chub gsum la 'god pa'i gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of the benefit for others, which is the establishment in the three enlightenments.

original: ngan song gsum las nges par thar pa dang / mtsho ris su 'god pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las gtan du rnam par thar pa ni shugs kyis bstan par shes par bya'o //🔽yang na ci'i phyir /
analyzed: ngan song gsum las nges par thar pa dang / mtsho ris su 'god pa dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las gtan du rnam par thar pa ni shugs kyis bstan par shes par bya'o // yang na ci'i phyir /
translated: One should understand that the definite liberation from the three miserable realms, the establishment in the family of the lake-born ones, and the permanent liberation from the suffering of cyclic existence are taught by implication.

original: 'di las rdzogs pa'i byang chub nye zhe na /
analyzed: 'di las rdzogs pa'i byang chub nye zhe na /
translated: Or, why is it that perfect enlightenment is near in this?

original: 'di ltar khyed /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed /
translated: It is because of this:

original: zhi ba'i gnas ni thob gyur nas //
analyzed: zhi ba'i gnas ni thob gyur nas //
translated: Having attained the state of peace,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur//
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur//
translated: one will attain perfect enlightenment.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis nye ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis nye ste /
translated: This shows the nearness.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ril po 'dis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ril po 'dis ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This entire verse shows the perfection of one's own goal.

original: da ni de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzungs 'di 'thob pa'i thabs bstan te /
analyzed: da ni de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzungs 'di 'thob pa'i thabs bstan te /
translated: Now, from Then the Blessed One... and so on, the means of attaining this dhāraṇī are taught.🔽What kind of wise one, where,

original: blo ldan ci 'dra gang du dang // ji ltar gnas dang gang bsgoms dang // gang byas pas ni 'thob 'gyur ba //
analyzed: blo ldan ci 'dra gang du dang // ji ltar gnas dang gang bsgoms dang // gang byas pas ni 'thob 'gyur ba //
translated: how abiding, what meditating, what doing will attain?

original: de ni bzhi tshan rnams kyis bstan //
analyzed: de ni bzhi tshan rnams kyis bstan //
translated: This is taught by the four groups.

original: rnal 'byor pa ji lta bus gzungs 'di thob par 'gyur ba de ni bzhi tshan dang pos bstan to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ji lta bus gzungs 'di thob par 'gyur ba de ni bzhi tshan dang pos bstan to //
translated: The first group of four teaches what kind of yogi/ni attains this dhāraṇī.

original: gang du gnas pa dang / ji ltar gnas pa de gnyis ni gnyis pas bstan to //
analyzed: gang du gnas pa dang / ji ltar gnas pa de gnyis ni gnyis pas bstan to //
translated: The second teaches where they live and how they live.

original: gang sgom pa dang / gang bya ba de gnyis ni gsum pas bstan to //
analyzed: gang sgom pa dang / gang bya ba de gnyis ni gsum pas bstan to //
translated: The third teaches what they meditate on and what they do.

original: rnal 'byor pa ji lta bus gzungs 'di thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ji lta bus gzungs 'di thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What kind of yogi/ni attains this dhāraṇī?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / khrims ldan de yi mi mthun phyogs //
analyzed: smras pa / khrims ldan de yi mi mthun phyogs //
translated: They have ethics, the opposite of that,

original: gnyis grol de yi 'phel byed ldan //
analyzed: gnyis grol de yi 'phel byed ldan //
translated: are free from the two, and have what increases that.

original: nyes pa dang ni phan yon rnams //
analyzed: nyes pa dang ni phan yon rnams //
translated: Through teaching the faults and benefits,

original: bstan pas de la 'dzud par byed //
analyzed: bstan pas de la 'dzud par byed //
translated: they are introduced to that.

original: 'dod pa rnams la lhag par chags pa med pa zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims dang ldan par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la lhag par chags pa med pa zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims dang ldan par bstan te /
translated: “They are not attached to desires” teaches that they have ethics.

original: tshul khrims ni yon tan thams cad kyi gzhi yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni yon tan thams cad kyi gzhi yin no //
translated: Ethics is the basis of all good qualities.

original: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan rnams lhag par chags pa med na /
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan rnams lhag par chags pa med na /
translated: If they are not attached to the five sense pleasures,

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi byed do //🔽de lta bas na de spangs pa'i @36a * //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi byed do // de lta bas na de spangs pa'i @36a * //
translated: One does not kill, etc.

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims kyang thob pa nyid pas logs shig tu ma bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshul khrims kyang thob pa nyid pas logs shig tu ma bstan to //
translated: Thus, since one has already attained morality which has the nature of abandoning those, it is not taught separately.

original: tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs phrag dog dang ser sna las grol ba ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs phrag dog dang ser sna las grol ba ni /
translated: Liberation from jealousy and avarice, which are the resistances to morality,

original: sems can thams cad la phrag dog med pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong zhing 'gyod pa med pa yin zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phrag dog med pa dang / bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong zhing 'gyod pa med pa yin zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: is indicated by the statement: “One is without jealousy toward any sentient being and one gives away all one’s possessions without regret.”

original: phrag dog dang ser sna dag ni tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams yin te /
analyzed: phrag dog dang ser sna dag ni tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams yin te /
translated: Jealousy and avarice are the resistances to morality,

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams la lhag par chags na phrag dog byed pa dang / ser sna byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams la lhag par chags na phrag dog byed pa dang / ser sna byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: because when one is attached to sense objects, one becomes jealous and avaricious.

original: sems can thams cad la zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la zhes smos pa ni /
translated: The phrase “toward any sentient being”

original: dgra bo dang mdza' bo dang tha mal pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bo dang mdza' bo dang tha mal pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is stated in order to include enemies, friends, and neutral persons.

original: bdog pa thams cad ces smos pa ni phyi rol dang nang gi bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad ces smos pa ni phyi rol dang nang gi bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase all one's possessions includes both external and internal things.

analyzed: 'gyod pa med pa zhes smos pa ni sems la 'dzin pa med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: tshig 'di gsum gyis ni tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa bstan to //

analyzed: 'gyod pa med par sbyin pa'i tshul can ni yid la gcags pa med par sbyin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase one who gives without regret means one who gives without mental anguish.

original: nyin mtshan du chos 'dod cing chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba yin te zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims 'phel bar byed pa gang ngag dang ldan pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: nyin mtshan du chos 'dod cing chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba yin te zhes bya ba 'dis ni tshul khrims 'phel bar byed pa gang ngag dang ldan pa nyid bstan to //
translated: One who is devoted to the Dharma day and night, and delights in the Dharma, shows the possession of speech which increases morality.

original: chos la sred pa'i phyir chos 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos la sred pa'i phyir chos 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes devoted to the Dharma because of craving for the Dharma.

original: nan tan byed pas ni chos la dga'o //
analyzed: nan tan byed pas ni chos la dga'o //

original: yang na chos rnams la 'jug phyir chos 'dod do //
analyzed: yang na chos rnams la 'jug phyir chos 'dod do //
translated: Alternatively, one is devoted to the Dharma because of engagement in the Dharma.

original: goms pa'i phyir chos la dga'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i phyir chos la dga'o //
translated: One delights in the Dharma because of cultivation.

analyzed: yang na nam gyi cha stong dang nam gyi cha smad la sogs par brtson pa'i phyir chos 'dod par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos bsgom pa'i phyir chos la dga'o //
translated: He is fond of the Dharma because he cultivates the Dharma of emptiness, etc.

original: yang na gnyis su nges par gzung ba'i phyir gsungs te /
analyzed: yang na gnyis su nges par gzung ba'i phyir gsungs te /
translated: Or else, he is desirous of the Dharma because he is intent on the Dharma.

original: 'dis ni rtog pa ngan pa med pa'i phyir don gyis na /
analyzed: 'dis ni rtog pa ngan pa med pa'i phyir don gyis na /
translated: He is fond of the Dharma because he cultivates the Dharma of emptiness, etc.🔽Or else, he is desirous of the Dharma because he is intent on the Dharma.

analyzed: 'khrig pa'i sbyor ba bdun dang bral ba'i tshul khrims bstan to //

original: nyes pa dang phan yon bstan pa'i rgyus tshul khrims la sogs pa de dag la 'dzud de /
analyzed: nyes pa dang phan yon bstan pa'i rgyus tshul khrims la sogs pa de dag la 'dzud de /
translated: He is fond of the Dharma because he cultivates the Dharma of emptiness, etc.

original: gdul ba zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma'o //🔽de yang tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis bstan to //
analyzed: gdul ba zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma'o // de yang tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis bstan to //
translated: Or else, he is desirous of the Dharma because he is intent on the Dharma.

original: de la rnam pa lngas tshul khrims la 'dzud de //🔽'dod pa rnams kyi nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de la rnam pa lngas tshul khrims la 'dzud de // 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa la /
translated: He is fond of the Dharma because he cultivates the Dharma of emptiness, etc.🔽Or else, he is desirous of the Dharma because he is intent on the Dharma.🔽He is fond of the Dharma because he cultivates the Dharma of emptiness, etc.🔽Or else, he is desirous of the Dharma because he is intent on the Dharma.🔽He is fond of the Dharma because he cultivates the Dharma of emptiness, etc.🔽Or else, he is desirous of the Dharma because he is intent on the Dharma.🔽He is fond of the Dharma because he cultivates the Dharma of emptiness, etc.🔽Or else, he is desirous of the Dharma because he is intent on the Dharma.

original: dri nga ba ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri nga ba ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is fond of the Dharma because he cultivates the Dharma of emptiness, etc.🔽Or else, he is desirous of the Dharma because he is intent on the Dharma.🔽He is fond of the Dharma because he cultivates the Dharma of

original: yang na 'dod pa'i rtsa ba lus kyi @36b mi gtsang pa'i dri dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i rtsa ba lus kyi @36b mi gtsang pa'i dri dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is low because it is associated with the foul odor of the body, the root of desire.

original: ngan pa ni thams cad kyi tha chad du gyur pa'i phyir dang / sems can ngan pas bsten pa'i phyir dang / dam pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir dang / bum pa mi gtsang ba can la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu ngan pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: ngan pa ni thams cad kyi tha chad du gyur pa'i phyir dang / sems can ngan pas bsten pa'i phyir dang / dam pa rnams kyis smad pa'i phyir dang / bum pa mi gtsang ba can la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir dang / 'bras bu ngan pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro//
translated: It is vile because it is the worst of all, because it is the support of vile sentient beings, because it is despised by the holy ones, because it is like a pot of excrement, etc., and because it produces vile effects.

original: bdud kyi spyod yul ni bdud kyi yul las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi spyod yul ni bdud kyi yul las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the domain of Mara because it does not transcend the domain of Mara.

original: bdud ni lha'i bu'am /
analyzed: bdud ni lha'i bu'am /
translated: Mara is either a son of god,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: or the defilements such as passion,🔽or both.

original: gnyis ka'o // sems can dmyal ba'i rkyen ni de 'grub par byed pa dang / de 'grub par 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka'o // sems can dmyal ba'i rkyen ni de 'grub par byed pa dang / de 'grub par 'gyur ba'i las kyis sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The condition of the hells is the action that produces the hells and that causes one to go to the hells.

original: sems can dmyal ba smos pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba smos pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The hells are mentioned because they are the principal ones.

original: dud 'gro dang yi dgas gnyis kyi rkyen yang 'dod pa rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dud 'gro dang yi dgas gnyis kyi rkyen yang 'dod pa rnams yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conditions for animals and ghosts are also desire.

original: ngan song gi rgyu ni ma rungs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngan song gi rgyu ni ma rungs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The cause of the lower realms is the cause of the lower realms.

original: 'dod phyir 'jig rten bcing dang bsad par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dod phyir 'jig rten bcing dang bsad par 'gyur //
translated: For the sake of desire, the world is bound and killed.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is stated in the scriptures.

original: yang na ngan song gi rgyu ni ngan song gsum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na ngan song gi rgyu ni ngan song gsum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the cause of the lower realms is the cause of the three lower realms.

original: sems can dmyal ba smos pa ni gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs phrag dog spong ba la 'dud pa ni //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba smos pa ni gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir ro // de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs phrag dog spong ba la 'dud pa ni //
translated: The mention of hell beings is for the sake of teaching the main point.

original: phan yon bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa lngas bstan te /
analyzed: phan yon bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa lngas bstan te /
translated: The elimination of the opposing factors of jealousy is shown in five aspects for the sake of teaching the benefits.

original: spang bar bya ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa dang / spang bar bya ba'i yul bstan pa dang / spang bar bya ba'i rgyu bstan pa la /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i rang bzhin bstan pa dang / spang bar bya ba'i yul bstan pa dang / spang bar bya ba'i rgyu bstan pa la /
translated: The nature of what is to be eliminated is taught, the object of what is to be eliminated is taught, the cause of what is to be eliminated is taught, the result of what is to be eliminated is taught, and the antidote to what is to be eliminated is taught.

original: rgyu de yang shes kyi khe dang rnyed pa dang grags pa'i bye brag las rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu de yang shes kyi khe dang rnyed pa dang grags pa'i bye brag las rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
translated: The cause is shown to be of three kinds, from the point of view of the particular kind of gain, wealth, or fame.

original: shes kyi khe ni kun du bstan pas 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes kyi khe ni kun du bstan pas 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Gain is the gathering of disciples through teaching.

original: de'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin bstan pa ni /
translated: The nature of that is shown:

original: dga' ba'i mig ni dga' bas lta ba ste /
analyzed: dga' ba'i mig ni dga' bas lta ba ste /
translated: with eyes of joy, he looks on with joy,

original: khro ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is free from the faults of anger, etc.

original: de spang ba'i phan yon bstan pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te mthu che ba thob pa /
analyzed: de spang ba'i phan yon bstan pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te mthu che ba thob pa /
translated: The benefit of abandoning that is also shown to be of two kinds:

original: nor dang 'khor la sogs 'byor ba 'thob pa'i phyir dang / gzugs mdzes pa 'thob pa yan lag dang nying lag gi gzugs mdzes pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor dang 'khor la sogs 'byor ba 'thob pa'i phyir dang / gzugs mdzes pa 'thob pa yan lag dang nying lag gi gzugs mdzes pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one obtains great power, because one obtains wealth, retinue, etc. ; and one obtains a beautiful form, because one obtains a beautiful body and limbs.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna spang ba la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna spang ba la 'jug pa ni /
translated: The engagement in abandoning the resistance to that, stinginess,

original: nyes pa dang phan yon bstan phyir rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
analyzed: nyes pa dang phan yon bstan phyir rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
translated: is shown to be of four kinds, from the point of view of the teaching of the faults and benefits.

original: nyes dmigs bstan pa ni rtsod pa ste lus la sogs pa'i bya ba gnod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: nyes dmigs bstan pa ni rtsod pa ste lus la sogs pa'i bya ba gnod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the faults is shown as conflict, which is the harm to the body, etc.

original: de'i rgyu bstan pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu bstan pa ni yongs su 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The cause of that is shown to be grasping.

original: @37a * // bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pas dngos por 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: @37a * // bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pas dngos por 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Grasping is the apprehension of things through the manifest adherence to “I” and “mine.🔽”

original: gzhi rtsa smos pas ni dngos dang brgyud pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i don te /
analyzed: gzhi rtsa smos pas ni dngos dang brgyud pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i don te /
translated: The mention of “basis” and “root” is for the purpose of showing the nature of the direct and indirect causes.

original: 'di yang yongs su 'dzin pa 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du gnod pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pas gdul ba rnams de las 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang yongs su 'dzin pa 'di ni rnam pa thams cad du gnod pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pas gdul ba rnams de las 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, this grasping is shown to be the cause of all harm, in order to turn the disciples away from it.

original: sred pa'i yul yongs su spang ba ni spang ba ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i yul yongs su spang ba ni spang ba ste /
translated: The object of craving is abandoned,

original: de la lhag par chags pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lhag par chags pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to abandon attachment to it.

original: de'i phan yon bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phan yon bstan pa ni /
translated: The benefits of that are shown.

original: gzungs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzungs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The dhāraṇī is called

original: gzungs 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzungs 'di nyid yin no //
translated: this very dhāraṇī.

original: de yang dus gzhan la dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang dus gzhan la dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, that is stated with an intention directed to another time.

original: de 'phel bar byed pa la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: de 'phel bar byed pa la 'jug pa ni /
translated: The engagement in its increase

original: phan yon bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa ldas bstan te /
analyzed: phan yon bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa ldas bstan te /
translated: is shown by ten aspects in order to show the benefits.

original: chos tshol ba ni chos ni stong pa nyid dang / de ston pa'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: chos tshol ba ni chos ni stong pa nyid dang / de ston pa'i yi ge'o //
translated: The Dharma is emptiness and the letters that teach it.

original: de 'dri ba ni 'dri ba la sogs pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dri ba ni 'dri ba la sogs pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: To seek it is to seek the stages of writing and so on.🔽Therefore, it is said:🔽Writing, worship, giving,🔽reading, listening, memorizing,🔽teaching, reciting,

original: de'i phyir / yi ge 'dri mchod sbyin pa dang // klog dang nyan dang 'dzin pa dang // ston dang kha ton byed pa dang // sems dang bsgom pa gang yin pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yi ge 'dri mchod sbyin pa dang // klog dang nyan dang 'dzin pa dang // ston dang kha ton byed pa dang // sems dang bsgom pa gang yin pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: contemplating, and meditating.

original: rgyun mi chad par tshol ba ni las ngan pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun mi chad par tshol ba ni las ngan pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Seeking without interruption is for the sake of abandoning evil actions.

original: gzhan mi sems par tshol ba ni log par rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang / mtho ris la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa rnam par rtog pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan mi sems par tshol ba ni log par rnam par rtog pa yongs su spang ba dang / mtho ris la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa rnam par rtog pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Seeking without other thoughts is for the sake of abandoning wrong thoughts and abandoning thoughts of attaining the fruits of rebirth in the higher realms, and so on.

original: byang chub 'dod cing tshol ba ni de byang chub kyi rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyi rgyu gzungs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub 'dod cing tshol ba ni de byang chub kyi rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir byang chub kyi rgyu gzungs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Seeking with the desire for enlightenment is for the sake of showing that it is the cause of enlightenment, because the dhāraṇī is the cause of enlightenment.

original: chos tshig ni stong pa nyid dang // de ston pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos tshig ni stong pa nyid dang // de ston pa'i mdo sde la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words of the Dharma are emptiness and the sūtras that teach it.

original: tshigs su bcad pa dang po las ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa 'ba' zhig bstan la /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa dang po las ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa 'ba' zhig bstan la /
translated: In the first verse, only the faults of the opposing side are taught.

original: gnyen po'i yon tan ni ma bstan /
analyzed: gnyen po'i yon tan ni ma bstan /
translated: The qualities of the antidote are not taught.

original: gnyis pa dang tha ma las ni gnyen po'i yon tan 'ba' zhig bstan la /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang tha ma las ni gnyen po'i yon tan 'ba' zhig bstan la /
translated: In the second and last verses, only the qualities of the antidote are taught.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa ma bstan /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa ma bstan /
translated: The faults of the opposing side are not taught.

original: gsum pa las ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po gnyi ga'i yon tan dang skyon bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gsum pa las ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po gnyi ga'i yon tan dang skyon bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: In the third verse, aren't the qualities and faults of both the opposing side and the antidote taught?

original: ci'i phyir de ltar bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are they taught in that way?

original: de ni gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis kyi yon tan dang nyes pa bstan pa gung du gces pa yod do //
analyzed: de ni gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyis kyi yon tan dang nyes pa bstan pa gung du gces pa yod do //
translated: It is to show the qualities and faults of both the antidote and the opposing side.

original: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa dang po la ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa dang po la ni /
translated: Therefore, in the first verse,

original: 'dod pa'i gnyen po'i tshul khrims dri zhim po bsten par bya'o zhes @37b bya ba la sogs pas yon tan yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gnyen po'i tshul khrims dri zhim po bsten par bya'o zhes @37b bya ba la sogs pas yon tan yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should also consider the virtues, such as: “One should rely on the fragrant morality that is the antidote to desire.”

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa dang / bzhi pa dag la yang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa dang / bzhi pa dag la yang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyes pa yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the second and fourth verses, one should also consider the faults that are the opposites of those.

original: sngar bstan pa yi don nyid ni //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa yi don nyid ni //
translated: The same point that was taught above🔽is taught again in the verses

original: chos kyi rjes 'brang ched du ste //🔽rigs pa phan yon bye brag gis //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes 'brang ched du ste // rigs pa phan yon bye brag gis //
translated: for the sake of those who follow the teachings🔽and for those who follow faith.

original: tshigs bcad rnams kyis yang bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs bcad rnams kyis yang bstan to //
translated: The same point that was taught above is taught again in the verses

original: rnam pa gzhan yang sngar bstan pa'i don nyid chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / zhar la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang du yang mdzad de /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang sngar bstan pa'i don nyid chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / zhar la dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dbang du yang mdzad de /
translated: for the sake of those who follow the teachings and for those who follow faith incidentally.

original: rigs pa dang phan yon gyi bye brag gi rgyus /
analyzed: rigs pa dang phan yon gyi bye brag gi rgyus /
translated: By the power of the distinctions of reason and benefit,

original: yang tshigs su bcad pa dag gis bstan te /
analyzed: yang tshigs su bcad pa dag gis bstan te /
translated: it is taught again in the verses.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ni dri nga ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ni dri nga ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, in order to abandon desire, the reasonings of foulness, etc., are taught.

original: phrag dog mi bya ba'i phyir ni mthu che ba la sogs pa thob pa'i phan yon gsungs la /
analyzed: phrag dog mi bya ba'i phyir ni mthu che ba la sogs pa thob pa'i phan yon gsungs la /
translated: The benefits of attaining great power, etc. are taught in order to prevent jealousy.

original: de mi bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu khyad par can 'thob bo zhes rgyu yang gsungs so //
analyzed: de mi bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu khyad par can 'thob bo zhes rgyu yang gsungs so //
translated: And in order to prevent that, the cause is also taught: “One attains a special result.”

original: ser sna'i rgyu sred pa'i yul yongs su spang ba'i phyir ni rgyu rtsod pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ser sna'i rgyu sred pa'i yul yongs su spang ba'i phyir ni rgyu rtsod pa gsungs so //
translated: The cause of stinginess is taught in order to completely abandon craving for objects.

original: rtsa ba bzhi pas ni phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: rtsa ba bzhi pas ni phan yon bstan to //
translated: The fourth root [verse] teaches the benefits.

original: tshul khrims 'phel bar byed pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir ni 'bras bu khyad par can 'thob bo zhes rgyu smos la /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'phel bar byed pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir ni 'bras bu khyad par can 'thob bo zhes rgyu smos la /
translated: The cause is stated: “One attains a special result” in order to teach the Dharma that increases morality.

original: phan yon ni dngos su bstan pa nyid do //🔽da ni gang du gnas pa dang / ji ltar gnas pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan yon ni dngos su bstan pa nyid do // da ni gang du gnas pa dang / ji ltar gnas pa de bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: dgon sogs gnas shing zab mo yi //
analyzed: dgon sogs gnas shing zab mo yi //
translated: Staying in a solitary place, etc.,🔽One should practice the profound

original: chos rnams la ni legs par spyod //🔽rnyed dang bkur sti tshigs bcad la //
analyzed: chos rnams la ni legs par spyod // rnyed dang bkur sti tshigs bcad la //
translated: Dharmas.🔽Without excessive attachment to

original: lhag par chags med brtul zhugs can //
analyzed: lhag par chags med brtul zhugs can //
translated: Gain, honor, and praise,🔽One should be disciplined.

original: rtag tu sdug pa'i dngos po kun //
analyzed: rtag tu sdug pa'i dngos po kun //
translated: One always gives away all pleasant things,

original: 'bras bu la ni mi lta ba'am //
analyzed: 'bras bu la ni mi lta ba'am //
translated: without regard for the results,

original: 'dzin med sems kyis gtod byed pas //
analyzed: 'dzin med sems kyis gtod byed pas //
translated: and one gives with a mind free of grasping.

original: gzungs 'di 'thob par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: gzungs 'di 'thob par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: Thus one attains this retention.

original: gong du gnas pa zhes bya ba de /
analyzed: gong du gnas pa zhes bya ba de /

analyzed: dgon pa dang / g-ye'i tshig gis bstan te /
translated: The phrase “dwells in the above manner” is explained by the words “in a secluded place” and “in solitude.”

analyzed: lus kyi 'du 'dzin yongs su spangs pas 'du ba'i nyes pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dgon pa ni grong nas 'dom lnga brgya phan chad do //
translated: A secluded place is more than five hundred bow-lengths from a village.

original: g-yeng ni de bas kyang ring ba'o //
analyzed: g-yeng ni de bas kyang ring ba'o //
translated: Solitude is even farther away than that.

analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni dbye bsdu'o //
