original: ji ltar gnas pa de ni log par rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa dang / 'du 'dzi yongs su spang pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa de ni log par rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa dang / 'du 'dzi yongs su spang pa'i phyir /
translated: Because one has abandoned the faults of crowds by completely abandoning the distractions of the body.🔽A secluded place is more than five hundred bow-lengths from a village.🔽Solitude is even farther away than that.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: The phrase “and so on” refers to the divisions and classifications.🔽The phrase “dwells in the above manner” is explained by the words “in a secluded place” and “in solitude.”🔽Because one has abandoned the faults of crowds by completely abandoning the distractions of the body.

original: des ni lus dang sems dag gis bsrings chos gang bskyed mi nus pa de 'ga' yang med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des ni lus dang sems dag gis bsrings chos gang bskyed mi nus pa de 'ga' yang med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: A secluded

original: @38a * // chos zab mo la spyod pa ni chos zab mo la bzod pa'i stobs bskyed pa nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: @38a * // chos zab mo la spyod pa ni chos zab mo la bzod pa'i stobs bskyed pa nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The “power of patience with the profound Dharma” is the power of patience with the profound Dharma.

original: chos zab mo dag la bzod pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: chos zab mo dag la bzod pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Patience with the profound Dharma is the desire for it.

original: de'i stobs bskyed pa ni chen po la sogs pa'i rim pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs bskyed pa ni chen po la sogs pa'i rim pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: The power of patience is the development of the great stages of patience, and so on.

original: de'i dngos po ni chos zab mo la bzod pa'i stobs bskyed pa de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni chos zab mo la bzod pa'i stobs bskyed pa de nyid do //
translated: The power of patience with the profound Dharma is the power of patience with the profound Dharma.

original: yang na chos la bzod pa zab mo zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na chos la bzod pa zab mo zhes bya bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Or else, one should understand that patience with the Dharma is profound.

original: yul zab pa'i phyir de yang zab pa'o //🔽rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa dag la lhag par chags pa med pa ni /
analyzed: yul zab pa'i phyir de yang zab pa'o // rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa dag la lhag par chags pa med pa ni /
translated: And that patience is profound because its object is profound.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa dag la lhag par chags pa med ces gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa dag la lhag par chags pa med ces gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: “He is not attached to gain, honor, or fame” means that he is not attached to gain, honor, or fame.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni grags pa'o //
translated: Fame is praise.

original: lhag par chags pa med pa ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par chags pa med pa ni mngon par zhen pa med pa'o //
translated: Not being attached means not being attached to them.

original: rtag tu sdug pa'i dngos po thams cad mi lta ba yongs su gtong ba ni sdug pa'i dngos po thams cad la mi lta bar yongs su gtong zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu sdug pa'i dngos po thams cad mi lta ba yongs su gtong ba ni sdug pa'i dngos po thams cad la mi lta bar yongs su gtong zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Always giving up all pleasant things is giving up all pleasant things without regard for them.

original: thams cad smos pa ni phyi nang gi dngos po yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni phyi nang gi dngos po yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word all refers to internal and external things.

original: mi lta bar gtod pa ni mtho ris dang / lan du phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la mi lta bar yongs su gtod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mi lta bar gtod pa ni mtho ris dang / lan du phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu la mi lta bar yongs su gtod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Giving up without regard is giving up without regard for the result, such as rebirth in the higher realms or the return of a favor.

original: 'dzin pa med pa'i sems kyis yongs su gtong pas na sdug pa'i dngos po thams cad la mi lta bar yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa med pa'i sems kyis yongs su gtong pas na sdug pa'i dngos po thams cad la mi lta bar yongs su gtong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Or, giving up all pleasant things without regard means giving up with a mind free of grasping,

original: btang ngam mi btang snyam pa la sogs pa'i ne ma nur dang / le lo la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang ngam mi btang snyam pa la sogs pa'i ne ma nur dang / le lo la sogs pa'i 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no grasping at hesitation, laziness, etc., thinking, “Should I give or not give?”

original: cher na lus dang srog kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cher na lus dang srog kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Even my body and life, much less🔽my children and so on.

original: bu la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bu la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it is not just my children and so on.

original: lus dang srog gtong ba ni nang gi yin pas dka' ba'i phyir de gnyis smos so //
analyzed: lus dang srog gtong ba ni nang gi yin pas dka' ba'i phyir de gnyis smos so //
translated: The giving of body and life is mentioned because it is difficult, since it is internal.

original: bu la sogs pa gtong ba ni phyi rol gyi yin pa'i phyir sla'o //
analyzed: bu la sogs pa gtong ba ni phyi rol gyi yin pa'i phyir sla'o //
translated: The giving of children and so on is easy, since it is external.

original: lus gtong ba ni lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa gtong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus gtong ba ni lag pa dang rkang pa la sogs pa gtong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The giving of the body is the giving of hands, feet, etc.

original: lus thams cad gtong na srog gtong ba yin no //
analyzed: lus thams cad gtong na srog gtong ba yin no //
translated: When one gives the whole body, one gives life.

original: dang po gnas yin de nas las //
analyzed: dang po gnas yin de nas las //
translated: First, the place; then, the action;

original: de nas rnyed sogs tshol ba spong //🔽der yang ma zad thams cad la //
analyzed: de nas rnyed sogs tshol ba spong // der yang ma zad thams cad la //
translated: Then, the avoidance of the search for gain, etc.

original: mi lta ba yang gtong bar byed //
analyzed: mi lta ba yang gtong bar byed //
translated: There, too, one should give without regard for anything,🔽Even one's own life.

original: bzhi tshan 'di'i don go rims bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bzhi tshan 'di'i don go rims bzhin du bstan par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of these four groups should be explained in order.

original: gnas med par bsgom du mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas med par bsgom du mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not suitable to cultivate without a place,

original: re zhig thog mar dgon pa la sogs pa gnas gsungs so //
analyzed: re zhig thog mar dgon pa la sogs pa gnas gsungs so //
translated: first of all, a place such as a forest is mentioned.

original: der gnas nas @38b kyang zhing la sogs pa'i las ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: der gnas nas @38b kyang zhing la sogs pa'i las ni mi bya'o //
translated: Even dwelling there, one should not do the work of a farmer, etc.

original: las 'di lta bu bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las 'di lta bu bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show what kind of work one should do,

original: gnas kyi 'og tu chos zab mo la bzod pa'i stobs bskyed pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gnas kyi 'og tu chos zab mo la bzod pa'i stobs bskyed pa gsungs so //
translated: After the section on place, the power of patience with the profound doctrine is taught.

original: gnas dang las de dag gis rnyed pa la sogs pa btsal ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas dang las de dag gis rnyed pa la sogs pa btsal ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: By means of these places and actions, the search for gain, etc. is to be abandoned.

original: de lta ma yin na dgon par gnas pa dang / chos zab mo la bzod pa'i stobs bskyed pa don med par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dgon par gnas pa dang / chos zab mo la bzod pa'i stobs bskyed pa don med par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that otherwise, dwelling in the forest and the power of patience with the profound doctrine would be pointless,

original: las kyi 'og tu rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa dag la lhag par chags pa med pa gsungs so //
analyzed: las kyi 'og tu rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa dag la lhag par chags pa med pa gsungs so //
translated: after the section on action, the absence of excessive attachment to gain, honor, and fame is taught.

original: phyi rol gyi yan lag rnyed pa la sogs pa dag la lhag par chags par mi bya bar yang ma zad kyi /🔽sdug pa'i dngos po thams cad la yang mi lta bar spang ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yan lag rnyed pa la sogs pa dag la lhag par chags par mi bya bar yang ma zad kyi / sdug pa'i dngos po thams cad la yang mi lta bar spang ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Not only is excessive attachment to external branches such as gain, etc. not to be made,🔽but also one should abandon all regard for pleasant things. In order to demonstrate this,

original: de'i 'og tu sdug pa'i dngos po thams cad la ma lta bar yongs su gtong ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sdug pa'i dngos po thams cad la ma lta bar yongs su gtong ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: after that, the total giving up of all pleasant things without regard is taught.

original: sngar bstan pa'i don nyid chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ched du gtan tshigs dang phan yon gyi bye brag gis /🔽tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis yang gsungs te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i don nyid chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ched du gtan tshigs dang phan yon gyi bye brag gis / tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis yang gsungs te /
translated: The same point taught above is stated again in verses by means of specific reasons and benefits for the sake of those who follow the teachings.🔽🔽

original: rgyal bas bsngags pa'i zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //🔽dgon par gnas par gyis zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal bas bsngags pa'i zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs bstan pa'o // dgon par gnas par gyis zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: For the sake of those who follow the Dharma, the same point taught above is stated again in verses, with a specific reason and benefit.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni nyes pa dang bdud kyi dgra thams cad las rgyal bas na rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni nyes pa dang bdud kyi dgra thams cad las rgyal bas na rgyal ba'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the Victor because he has conquered all faults and demons.

original: des bsngags pa ni 'du 'dzi la sogs pa'i nyes pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir dang / yon tan skye ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bsngags pa ni 'du 'dzi la sogs pa'i nyes pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir dang / yon tan skye ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: What he praises is the avoidance of faults such as socializing and the cause for the arising of good qualities.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i dbang gis dpe brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i dbang gis dpe brtag par bya'o //
translated: The example should be inferred based on what is to be established and the proof.

original: bdag ni dgon pa na gnas pa'o snyam pa la sogs pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pas /
analyzed: bdag ni dgon pa na gnas pa'o snyam pa la sogs pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pas /
translated: Thinking I am staying in the wilderness, one should not be arrogant.

original: de na gnas pas gzhan la brnyas mi bya /
analyzed: de na gnas pas gzhan la brnyas mi bya /
translated: One should not despise others because of staying there.

original: de lta na dgon pa de rgyal bas bsngags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na dgon pa de rgyal bas bsngags pa yin gyi /
translated: In that case, the monastery is praised by the Victorious One.

original: de lta ma yin na ni de rgyal bas smad pa kho na yin no //🔽'di ltar / rgyal bas bsngags pa'i dgon par gnas par gyis //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni de rgyal bas smad pa kho na yin no // 'di ltar / rgyal bas bsngags pa'i dgon par gnas par gyis //
translated: If it were not so, then it would be only despised by the Victorious One.

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Thus, “you should live in the forest praised by the Victorious One” is the reason.

original: de na gnas pas gzhan la brnyas mi bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: de na gnas pas gzhan la brnyas mi bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: “You should not despise others by living there” is the thesis.

original: zab mo'i chos zhes bya ba ni rgyal bas bsngags pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zab mo'i chos zhes bya ba ni rgyal bas bsngags pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: “The profound Dharma” is connected with “praised by the Victorious One.”

original: rgyal bas bsngags pa nyid ni ji skad du bstan pa'i chos zab mo la bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyal bas bsngags pa nyid ni ji skad du bstan pa'i chos zab mo la bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The praise by the Victorious One is because of patience with the profound Dharma as it is taught.

original: de lta ma yin na ni log par lta ba kho nar 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar na chos zab mo la bzod pa la 'dun pa bskyed pa @39a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni log par lta ba kho nar 'gyur ro // de ltar na chos zab mo la bzod pa la 'dun pa bskyed pa @39a * //
translated: If it were not so, then it would be only a wrong view.

original: ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: Thus, the generation of aspiration for patience with the profound Dharma is the thesis.

original: bde bar gshegs pas bsngags pa ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas bsngags pa ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: “Praised by the Well-Gone One” is the reason.

original: zab mo la bzod pa de la 'dun pa bskyed nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: zab mo la bzod pa de la 'dun pa bskyed nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is to be done after generating aspiration for that patience with the profound?

original: bag yod mgo la 'bar bzhin gnas par gyis //🔽zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bag yod mgo la 'bar bzhin gnas par gyis // zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Be heedful, as if your hair were on fire.

original: mgo la 'bar ba bzhin zhes smos pa ni 'bad pa dang ldan pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mgo la 'bar ba bzhin zhes smos pa ni 'bad pa dang ldan pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir te /
translated: The expression “as if your hair were on fire” indicates the presence of effort.

original: dper na mgo la me 'bar na 'bad pa chen pos mgo las me sel ba de bzhin du 'bad pa dang ldan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dper na mgo la me 'bar na 'bad pa chen pos mgo las me sel ba de bzhin du 'bad pa dang ldan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For example, if one’s hair or clothes were on fire, one would make a great effort to extinguish the fire on one’s head or body.

original: bag yod ces bya ba 'dis ni 'di ston par byed do //
analyzed: bag yod ces bya ba 'dis ni 'di ston par byed do //
translated: The same text explains the meaning of heedfulness:

original: chags pa dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo rnams spangs te /
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug dang / le lo rnams spangs te /
translated: “Abandon desire, hatred, ignorance, and laziness.

original: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan par gnas par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan par gnas par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Abide in nonattachment, nonhatred, nonignorance, and diligence.

original: chos bzhi po 'di dag la bag yod pa zhes ming du 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar tshul 'chos byed kyi gzhi yin pa //
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di dag la bag yod pa zhes ming du 'dogs pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar tshul 'chos byed kyi gzhi yin pa //
translated: These four dharmas are called heedfulness.”

original: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is stated:🔽“Because they are the basis of hypocrisy.”

original: shes khe rnyed pa rnams la gnas ma byed //
analyzed: shes khe rnyed pa rnams la gnas ma byed //
translated: Do not make a home for the acquisition of knowledge.

original: ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba ste /
translated: This is the thesis.

original: rnyed pa smos pas ni rdzas dang bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / 'tsho ba log pa la sogs pa'i rnyed pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa smos pas ni rdzas dang bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / 'tsho ba log pa la sogs pa'i rnyed pa bsdu'o //
translated: By mentioning “acquisition” it includes acquisition of material things, honor, verse, and wrong livelihood.

original: tshul 'chos pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don te /
analyzed: tshul 'chos pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don te /
translated: The mention of “hypocrisy” is for the purpose of illustration.

original: kha gsag la sogs pa yang bsdu'o //
analyzed: kha gsag la sogs pa yang bsdu'o //
translated: It includes flattery and so on.

original: gnas pa ni lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: “Home” means attachment.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'tsho bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'tsho bar bya zhe na /
translated: “But how should one live?”

original: ngan ngon dag gis chog bya ste //
analyzed: ngan ngon dag gis chog bya ste //
translated: One should be satisfied with whatever one gets.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: rtsva dang / lo ma dang / chu la sogs pa ci yang rung ci rnyed pas chog par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtsva dang / lo ma dang / chu la sogs pa ci yang rung ci rnyed pas chog par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should be satisfied with whatever one gets, such as grass, leaves, water, and so on. This is the meaning.

original: de lta bus ji ltar 'tsho bar nus she na /
analyzed: de lta bus ji ltar 'tsho bar nus she na /
translated: “But how can one live in that way?”

original: bya dang 'dra bar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bya dang 'dra bar zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should live like a bird.

original: de lta bu'i brtul zhugs drag pos yon tan ci zhig 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i brtul zhugs drag pos yon tan ci zhig 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: “But what good quality is attained by such a strict discipline?”

original: mir gyur pa yi 'bras bu yod par byos //🔽zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: mir gyur pa yi 'bras bu yod par byos // zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Make the result of being a human being meaningful.

original: des ni phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: des ni phan yon bstan to //
translated: This teaches the benefits.

original: phan pa rnyed pa dang / gnod pa spangs pas mir gyur pa'i 'bras bu yod par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phan pa rnyed pa dang / gnod pa spangs pas mir gyur pa'i 'bras bu yod par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of acquiring benefit and abandoning harm, make the result of being a human being meaningful.

original: kye ma sangs rgyas bstan pa legs par rnyed //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: kye ma sangs rgyas bstan pa legs par rnyed // ces gsungs te /
translated: Oh! The teaching of the Buddha is well acquired.

original: des ni phan pa rnyed par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni phan pa rnyed par bstan to //
translated: This teaches the acquisition of benefit.

original: sdug bsngal mang po'i rtsa ba khyim yang spongs //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po'i rtsa ba khyim yang spongs //
translated: Abandon the home, the root of much suffering.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnod pa spang par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnod pa spang par bstan to //
translated: This teaches the abandonment of harm.

original: kye ma zhes bya ba 'di ya mtshan la bya ste /
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba 'di ya mtshan la bya ste /
translated: The word “oh” is used to express wonder.

original: legs par rnyed ces bya ba de dang sbyar @39b par bya ste /
analyzed: legs par rnyed ces bya ba de dang sbyar @39b par bya ste /
translated: It should be connected with the words “well acquired.”

original: 'khor ba na 'dris pa ma yin pa'i chos yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba rnyed pa ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor ba na 'dris pa ma yin pa'i chos yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang 'dra ba rnyed pa ni shin tu rnyed par dka' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is very difficult to acquire the Dharma, which is not familiar in cyclic existence, and which is like a wish-fulfilling gem,

original: kye ma legs par rnyed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kye ma legs par rnyed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Oh! It is well acquired.”

original: thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas bskyed pa'i chags pa spang bar dka' ba'i phyir yang /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas bskyed pa'i chags pa spang bar dka' ba'i phyir yang /
translated: Because it is difficult to abandon attachment that has been generated since beginningless cyclic existence,

original: kye ma spangs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kye ma spangs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: the Buddha said, “Alas, they have been abandoned!”

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa 'di rab tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa 'di rab tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the going forth in the teaching of the Buddha.

original: legs par rnyed pa ni mdzes par rnyed pa ste //
analyzed: legs par rnyed pa ni mdzes par rnyed pa ste //
translated: It is well obtained, beautifully obtained,

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs par 'dren pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba na 'dris pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs par 'dren pa'i phyir dang / 'khor ba na 'dris pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of all perfect qualities, because it leads to high status and certain goodness, and because it is not familiar in cyclic existence.

original: yang na phyir mi ldog pa rnyed pa ni legs par rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: yang na phyir mi ldog pa rnyed pa ni legs par rnyed pa ste /
translated: Or, it is well obtained because it is obtained irreversibly,

original: tshe rabs gzhan du yang phyir mi bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du yang phyir mi bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is irreversible in other lives.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the going forth that leads to nirvana.

original: yang na shin tu yongs su rdzogs par rnyed pas na legs par rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: yang na shin tu yongs su rdzogs par rnyed pas na legs par rnyed pa ste /
translated: Or, it is well obtained because it is obtained in a very complete way,

original: 'dod pa la kun tu rtog pa la sogs pas nyams par ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa la kun tu rtog pa la sogs pas nyams par ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not damaged by the conceptual thoughts of desire and so on.

original: sdug bsngal mang po'i rtsa ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po'i rtsa ba ni /
translated: The root of many sufferings🔽

original: bsgrub pa dang / bsrung ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rtsab yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang / bsrung ba dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rtsab yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The root of many sufferings is the household life, because it is the root of the suffering of acquisition, protection, separation from the loved, and encounter with the unloved, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa legs par rnyed pa'i rgyu ni khyim spangs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa legs par rnyed pa'i rgyu ni khyim spangs pa'o //
translated: The cause of the good acquisition of the Buddha’s teaching is the abandonment of the household life.

original: khyim pa'i tshig ni dgon pa na gnas pa nye bar mtshon pa'i don te /
analyzed: khyim pa'i tshig ni dgon pa na gnas pa nye bar mtshon pa'i don te /
translated: The word “house” is a metaphor for dwelling in the wilderness,

original: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa na yang khyim gyi nyes pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa na yang khyim gyi nyes pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the faults of the household life are possible even in monasteries and so on.

original: khyim spang pa'i rgyu ni sdug bsngal mang po'i rtsa ba nyid do //
analyzed: khyim spang pa'i rgyu ni sdug bsngal mang po'i rtsa ba nyid do //
translated: The cause of the abandonment of the household life is the root of many sufferings.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan par legs par rnyed pa dang / sdug bsngal mang po'i rtsa ba khyim spangs pa de'i phyir /🔽lus dang ngag dang yid kyang yongs dag pas //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi bstan par legs par rnyed pa dang / sdug bsngal mang po'i rtsa ba khyim spangs pa de'i phyir / lus dang ngag dang yid kyang yongs dag pas //
translated: Therefore, since the good acquisition of the Buddha’s teaching and the root of many sufferings are the abandonment of the household life,🔽you should respect the Buddha and the teaching with a pure body,

original: khyed sangs rgyas dang ni chos la gus par gyis //
analyzed: khyed sangs rgyas dang ni chos la gus par gyis //
translated: speech, and mind.

original: ngag dag pa ni ngag gi las dge ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: ngag dag pa ni ngag gi las dge ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Pure speech is the four kinds of virtuous speech.

original: lus dag pa ni lus kyi las dag pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: lus dag pa ni lus kyi las dag pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Pure action is the three kinds of pure bodily action.

original: yid dag pa ni brnab sems med pa la sogs pa yid kyi las rnam pa gsum po nyid do //
analyzed: yid dag pa ni brnab sems med pa la sogs pa yid kyi las rnam pa gsum po nyid do //
translated: Pure thought is the three kinds of pure mental action, such as noncovetousness.

original: 'dis ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag la gnas pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag la gnas pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the practice of the ten virtues.

original: sangs rgyas la gus par bya ba ni lam bzang po ston pas mchog tu phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la gus par bya ba ni lam bzang po ston pas mchog tu phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Respect for the Buddha is the highest benefit, because he teaches the good path.

original: chos la gus par bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa 'thob @40a * //🔽par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la gus par bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa 'thob @40a * // par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Respect for the Dharma is the attainment of the excellence of the virtues of nirvana, etc.

original: yang na sangs rgyas dang chos la gus par bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas dang chos la gus par bya ba ni /
translated: Or else, respect for the Buddha and the Dharma is

original: nan tan gyis bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nan tan gyis bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: the practice of earnest effort,

original: sangs rgyas bla mar gyis shig / chos bla mar gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bla mar gyis shig / chos bla mar gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: as it is said, “Make the Buddha your teacher, make the Dharma your teacher.”

original: de ltar phan pa rnyed pa la sogs pas mir gyur pa 'bras bu yod par byed pas /
analyzed: de ltar phan pa rnyed pa la sogs pas mir gyur pa 'bras bu yod par byed pas /
translated: Thus, one who has obtained benefit and so on, by making human existence fruitful,

original: rnyed pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pas rdzas la sogs pa'i rnyed pa gzhan spangs par bya'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnyed pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pas rdzas la sogs pa'i rnyed pa gzhan spangs par bya'o zhes brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: should avoid other acquisitions of wealth and so on, by teaching the faults of acquisition.

original: rnyed 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnyed 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To explain this, he says, “Desiring acquisition, etc.

original: rnyed pa 'dod pa ni dran pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur ba re re'i rgyu yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa 'dod pa ni dran pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur ba re re'i rgyu yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that desiring acquisition is the cause of each of the faults of lack of mindfulness, etc.

original: 'di ltar rnyed pa 'dod pas sems g-yengs nas phan tshun 'gro ba la ni dran pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur zhing byang chub kyang ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnyed pa 'dod pas sems g-yengs nas phan tshun 'gro ba la ni dran pa la sogs pa med par 'gyur zhing byang chub kyang ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because one who desires acquisition is distracted, and goes here and there, he lacks mindfulness, etc., and enlightenment is far away.

original: dran pa la sogs pa med pa yang re re nas rnyed pa yongs su spang ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa med pa yang re re nas rnyed pa yongs su spang ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Also, lack of mindfulness, etc., is the cause of each of the faults of abandoning acquisition.

original: yang na rnyed pa 'dod pa ni dran pa med pa kho na'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: yang na rnyed pa 'dod pa ni dran pa med pa kho na'i rgyu'o //
translated: Or, desiring acquisition is the cause of lack of mindfulness alone.

original: de yang shes rab med pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de yang shes rab med pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: And that is the cause of lack of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du snga ma snga ma med pa ni phyi ma phyi ma med pa'i rgyu yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du snga ma snga ma med pa ni phyi ma phyi ma med pa'i rgyu yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: So too, the absence of the former should be understood as the cause of the absence of the latter.

original: byang chub ring bar 'gyur ba rnyed pa yongs su spang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: byang chub ring bar 'gyur ba rnyed pa yongs su spang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The desire for gain is the cause of the distance from enlightenment, up to the cause of the abandonment of attainment.

original: yang na rnam pa gzhan yang rnyed pa 'dod pa ni dran pa med pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gzhan yang rnyed pa 'dod pa ni dran pa med pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Or, in another way, the desire for gain is the cause of the absence of mindfulness.

original: de gnyis kyang shes rab med pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang shes rab med pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Those two are the cause of the absence of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du gong nas gong du lnga'i bar gyis bskyed pa ni byang chub las ring ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gong nas gong du lnga'i bar gyis bskyed pa ni byang chub las ring ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: In the same way, the generation of the five, up to the cause of the distance from enlightenment, is the cause of the distance from enlightenment.

original: nyes dmigs rab 'byams 'di thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni rnyed pa 'dod pa yin pas /
analyzed: nyes dmigs rab 'byams 'di thams cad kyi rtsa ba ni rnyed pa 'dod pa yin pas /
translated: The root of all of these limitless disadvantages is the desire for gain.

original: de ltas rnyed pa yongs su spang bar bya //
analyzed: de ltas rnyed pa yongs su spang bar bya //
translated: Therefore, one should abandon gain.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ni gang bsgom pa dang / gang bya ba zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de bshad par bya ste /🔽don gcig rtogs nas kun shes na //
analyzed: de ni gang bsgom pa dang / gang bya ba zhes bstan pa gang yin pa de bshad par bya ste / don gcig rtogs nas kun shes na //
translated: Now, what was taught as “what is to be cultivated” and “what is to be done” should be explained.

original: brgyad ces bya bas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: brgyad ces bya bas ci zhig bya //
translated: When one realizes one meaning, what is the use of the so-called eight?

original: yi ge so so'i don shes na //
analyzed: yi ge so so'i don shes na //
translated: If one knows the meaning of each syllable,

original: 'di yang ha cang nyungs pa yin //
analyzed: 'di yang ha cang nyungs pa yin //
translated: this is also too little.

original: rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: The yogi/ni or

original: gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: anyone else,

original: yi ge gcig gi don khong du chud pas thams cad rtogs na ci'i phyir yi ge 'bru brgyad ces bstan /
analyzed: yi ge gcig gi don khong du chud pas thams cad rtogs na ci'i phyir yi ge 'bru brgyad ces bstan /
translated: if by understanding the meaning of one syllable everything is understood, why is it taught as the eight syllable seed?

original: 'on te yi ge so so'i don shes par bsgrub pa yin na ni //
analyzed: 'on te yi ge so so'i don shes par bsgrub pa yin na ni //
translated: But if it is established that one knows the meaning of each syllable,

original: de ltar na 'jig rten na aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yi ge ches mang po zhig yod pas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten na aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yi ge ches mang po zhig yod pas /
translated: then since there are many more syllables in the world, such as the syllable a,

original: yi ge 'bru brgyad ces bya ba 'di yang ha cang nyungs so zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge 'bru brgyad ces bya ba 'di yang ha cang nyungs so zhe na /
translated: this is also too little for the eight syllable seed.

original: nyes pa med pa de 'di ltar /🔽bstan bya @40b ston pa nyes pa yi //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa de 'di ltar / bstan bya @40b ston pa nyes pa yi //
translated: There is no fault, because🔽the essence of the fault of the

original: ngo bo de nyid rnam gsum bstan //
analyzed: ngo bo de nyid rnam gsum bstan //
translated: object of expression and the expression is taught as threefold.

original: bstan par bya ba ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba ni chos thams cad do //
translated: The object of expression is all phenomena.

original: ston pa po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: ston pa po ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The expresser is the enjoyment body and the emanation body.

original: nyan pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo ste /
analyzed: nyan pa ni gdul bya'i skye bo ste /
translated: The listener is the group of disciples.

original: de yang byis pa dang / mkhas pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de yang byis pa dang / mkhas pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Moreover, it is twofold, according to the distinction between the childish and the wise.

original: de dag gi ngo bo'i de kho na ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de dag gi ngo bo'i de kho na ni phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The reality of their nature is the unmistaken nature.

original: de yang rgyu las rnam gsum du bstan te /
analyzed: de yang rgyu las rnam gsum du bstan te /
translated: And that is taught as threefold, according to cause.

original: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
translated: And what is that cause?

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum spong ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum spong ba ste /
translated: It is the abandonment of the three kinds of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum ni bstan par bya ba dang / ston pa po dang / nyan pa por rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum ni bstan par bya ba dang / ston pa po dang / nyan pa por rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The three kinds of conceptualization are the conceptualization of the object to be taught, the teacher, and the listener.

original: de spangs na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de spangs na sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When those are abandoned, the recollection of the Buddha is realized, because it is free from conceptualization.

original: bstan bya gang yin de /
analyzed: bstan bya gang yin de /
translated: The object to be taught

original: rnam gnyis 'jig rten 'di na 'dris pa dang / ma 'dris pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam gnyis 'jig rten 'di na 'dris pa dang / ma 'dris pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is twofold, because of the distinction between the familiar and the unfamiliar in this world.

original: ci'i phyir bstan par bya ba de rnam pa gnyis su mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bstan par bya ba de rnam pa gnyis su mdzad ce na /
translated: Why is that object to be taught made twofold?

original: rgyu las mdzad de /
analyzed: rgyu las mdzad de /
translated: It is made so according to cause.

original: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
translated: And what is that cause?

original: mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub pa'i chos gzungs la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub pa'i chos gzungs la sogs pa rnams kyang ngo bo nyid med pa yin na /
translated: The Dharma that is accomplished through great application, such as the dhāraṇīs, also have no intrinsic reality.

original: skye ba la sogs pa gzhan lta ci smos zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa gzhan lta ci smos zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: How much more so for other things, such as arising?

original: bstan par bya ba nyid dbye bar mdzad de khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba nyid dbye bar mdzad de khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he divides the objects of expression into two types, because they are pervasive.

original: 'jig rten na 'dris pa'i bstan par bya ba yang /
analyzed: 'jig rten na 'dris pa'i bstan par bya ba yang /
translated: Even the objects of expression that are familiar in the world

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi'i bye brag gi rnam pa gnyis te rgyu las so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi'i bye brag gi rnam pa gnyis te rgyu las so //
translated: are of two types, distinguished by their characteristics and their bases of characteristics.

original: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that?

original: gang la mtshan nyid yod pa dang rgyus bskyed pa'i ngo bo de ji ltar med snyam du rtog pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la mtshan nyid yod pa dang rgyus bskyed pa'i ngo bo de ji ltar med snyam du rtog pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the conception that something that has a characteristic and an essence produced by a cause cannot be nonexistent.

original: rnam par smin pa smos pas ni bdag po'i 'bras bu yang mtshon te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa smos pas ni bdag po'i 'bras bu yang mtshon te /
translated: By mentioning the ripened effect, he also indicates the dominant effect,

original: de yang smin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang smin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that also has the nature of ripening.

original: 'jig rten nam 'dris pa'i bstan par bya ba yang /
analyzed: 'jig rten nam 'dris pa'i bstan par bya ba yang /
translated: Even the objects of expression that are familiar in the world

original: lam dang lam ma yin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lam dang lam ma yin pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: are of two types, distinguished by the path and what is not the path.

original: rgyu las mdzad do //
analyzed: rgyu las mdzad do //
translated: The cause is the performance.

original: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that cause?

original: chos de gnyi ga yang rnam par rtog pa spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos de gnyi ga yang rnam par rtog pa spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: The two dharmas are the abandonment of conceptualization.

original: de dag ji ltar med snyam du rnam par rtog pa de spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar med snyam du rnam par rtog pa de spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon the conceptualization that thinks, “How are they non-existent?”

original: yang thams cad rnam pa gcig tu mdzad de rgyu las so //
analyzed: yang thams cad rnam pa gcig tu mdzad de rgyu las so //
translated: Again, all are made into one, the cause is the performance.

original: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that cause?

original: bstan par bya ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa spong ba ste /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa spong ba ste /
translated: The abandonment of the conceptualization of the object of expression, etc.

original: de ni mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdus pa la dga' ba'i sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir bstan to //
translated: That is taught for the sake of benefiting sentient beings who delight in conciseness.🔽These eight syllables

original: yang na / yi ge 'bru brgyad 'di dag ni //
analyzed: yang na / yi ge 'bru brgyad 'di dag ni //
translated: are the eight samadhis

original: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas ldan pa //🔽@41a * // brgyad po dag gi ting 'dzin rnams //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas ldan pa // @41a * // brgyad po dag gi ting 'dzin rnams //
translated: of the wise bodhisattvas.

original: smos pa yin par thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: smos pa yin par thub pas gsungs //
translated: The Sage has taught them.

original: de yi don ni bsgoms pa la //

original: ba zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ba zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of the syllable va is the understanding, that is, the realization.

original: de bstan pa /
analyzed: de bstan pa /
translated: That is taught.

original: ba zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: ba zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: The meaning of the syllable va is the understanding, that is, the realization.

original: ji ltar zhe na byis pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na byis pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: How is that? He says, the Dharma of the childish, etc.

original: skye sogs skye ba med sogs kyis //
analyzed: skye sogs skye ba med sogs kyis //
translated: The engagement of birth, etc., by means of nonbirth, etc.,

original: 'jug pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag med shes pa gang yin de //
analyzed: 'jug pa skye ba med pa dang / 'gag med shes pa gang yin de //
translated: is the understanding of the nonarising and noncessation of consciousness.

original: khong du chud phyir gzhan du bzhed //
analyzed: khong du chud phyir gzhan du bzhed //
translated: It is accepted as other because of the realization.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni rga shi med pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni rga shi med pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase, etc., includes nonaging and nondeath.

original: de las don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa gang yin pa'i 'jug pa de'i skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa gang dag yin pa de sde tshan de gnyis ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas na /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa gang yin pa'i 'jug pa de'i skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa gang dag yin pa de sde tshan de gnyis ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas na /
translated: The non-arising and non-cessation of that engagement are empty of their own entities,

original: 'jug pa yang de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and engagement is similar to that.

original: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa de gnyis shes pa gang yin pa'i shes pa de khong du chud pa'i phyir gzhan du bzhed de /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa de gnyis shes pa gang yin pa'i shes pa de khong du chud pa'i phyir gzhan du bzhed de /
translated: The knowledge of those two, non-arising and non-cessation, is the knowledge that comprehends them.

original: bzhi pa dza zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzhi pa dza zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The fourth is called “comprehending the meaning of ja.”

original: de bstan pa dza zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de bstan pa dza zhes bya ba'i don khong du chud pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: That is explained as “comprehending the meaning of ja.”

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba med pa rnams kyi 'gro ba dang 'jug pa gang yin pa de'i /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba med pa rnams kyi 'gro ba dang 'jug pa gang yin pa de'i /
translated: The engagement and entry of birth, aging, and death and of non-birth, non-aging, and non-death

original: mi skye mi 'gag pa gang yin pa de dag la 'jug pa de khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: mi skye mi 'gag pa gang yin pa de dag la 'jug pa de khong du chud pa ste /
translated: The comprehension of the non-arising and non-cessation of those is the comprehension of their engagement.

original: des zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the meaning of “by that.”
